symptoms.description: 沒有嘔吐的現象，常用以區別病位未及少陽或胃經。 / No vomiting present; used to help distinguish patterns not involving the Shaoyang or stomach channels.

symptoms.name: 表證壯盛 / strong exterior signs
symptoms.description: 表邪明顯，惡寒發熱、汗多或脈浮等外感證候顯著。 / Pronounced exterior signs such as marked aversion to cold/fever, profuse sweating, or a floating pulse.

symptoms.name: 日晡 / dusk/late afternoon
symptoms.description: 指申時到戌時的黃昏時段，中醫用以描述陽明經發病之時機。 / The late afternoon/dusk period (shen to xu hours), traditionally associated with the Yangming channel activity.

syndromes.name: 大陷胸證 / Da Xian Xiong pattern (Great Collapsed Chest)
syndromes.name_en: Da Xian Xiong pattern (Great Collapsed Chest)
syndromes.description: 大陷胸證為《傷寒論》所載之急重實證，病因為痰、飲、水、熱互結壅阻於胸膈及中焦，使氣機不得下降或氣上逆，並可兼及水飲壅滯致循行受阻。病機要點：痰飲互結化熱或熱迫液聚，痰熱水三者在膈下、心下凝聚成實塊或膿樣浸潤，致膈下閉塞、橫膈不能下降，呼吸受阻。臨床主症：心下痞滿或心下按之硬如石（按則痛或不按而痛，重者按之石硬不近）；胸悶胸部壓迫感；氣不得下、短氣喘促、咳吐黃稠痰或大量痰塊；發熱或日晡潮熱、口渴口苦、便閉或乾結；舌質多見紅、舌苔黃厚或黃膩、舌燥；脈多沉緊有力，或滑數、沉實。分證要點：屬實邪閉阻之重證，脈沉緊、心下石硬者宜用大陷胸證治；脈浮滑、心下按之則痛且較輕者為小結胸（小陷胸證）；若無顯著大熱而以水飲為主者屬水結胸，可酌用丸劑或溫化法。與大承氣湯辨別：大承氣多為下焦實熱、大便秘結且兩側天樞部有壓痛；大陷胸為上焦痰熱水結於胸膈中心。現代對應可為胸腔或腹腔積液、胸膜或胰周炎性滲出、黏液或膿性積聚、嚴重痰飲阻塞或腫塊性梗阻。治法以峻下逐飲、瀉熱消結、通利胸下閉阻為要，臨床採短程大劑量速攻但須由有經驗之中醫師辨證施治並嚴密監護。危險徵象包括脈浮大、極度煩躁、意識改變、持續嘔吐、劇烈腹痛、急性腎功能惡化等，見此應停藥並轉西醫急救。孕婦、兒童、年老體弱及氣血虛、陰虛發熱者禁或慎用。使用期間應密切監測排便、尿量、生命徵象與電解質、腎功能等實驗室指標；必要時加用宣化理氣藥（如厚朴、枳實）以助氣機下行及化痰，但前提必須為實邪閉阻。 / Da Xian Xiong (Great Collapsed Chest) is an acute, severe replete pattern recorded in the Shanghan Lun. Etiology/pathomechanism: phlegm, fluid (yin), water and heat intermix and congeal to obstruct the chest (xiongge) and middle burner, preventing normal downward movement of qi or forcing qi upward; accumulated water/phlegm further impairs circulation. Key mechanism: phlegm-fluid with heat forms hard consolidations or viscous exudates beneath the diaphragm and in the epigastrium, blocking the diaphragm and limiting descent, producing respiratory compromise. Clinical features: epigastric/under-chest fullness with a palpable hard, stone-like mass (painful on pressure or so hard it is painful even without pressure); chest oppression or a sense of compression; inability of qi to descend, shortness of breath, rapid breathing, coughing up thick yellow sputum or large phlegm plugs; fever or late-afternoon tidal fever, thirst or bitter taste, constipation or dry stools; tongue often red with thick yellow or yellow-greasy coating, dry tongue; pulse commonly submerged, tight and forceful (chenjin), or slippery-rapid/sinkable and solid. Differentiation: this is a true (shi) obstructive emergency—deep tight pulse and heart-down stone-hard mass indicate Da Xian Xiong; a floating-slippery pulse with epigastric pain on pressure but less hardness indicates Xiao Xian Xiong (small trapped chest) treated by Xiao Xian Xiong Tang. If there is little overt heat and water predominates, consider water-binding patterns and choose appropriate modifications or pill forms. Distinguish from Da Chengqi Tang patterns: Da Chengqi involves lower-jiao constipation with bilateral abdominal tenderness at the tian shu points, whereas Da Xian Xiong involves upper-jiao/epigastric/phrenic obstruction by phlegm-heat-water. Modern correlates include pleural or peritoneal effusion, inflammatory exudates (eg acute pancreatitis with effusion), mucinous or purulent accumulations, severe phlegm-fluid obstruction, or tumor-related masses. Treatment principle: vigorous purgation to drain fluids and accumulations, clear heat, disperse and open the chest—short-course, relatively high-dose, rapid-acting therapy under experienced clinical supervision. Red flags (avoid or stop): floating-large pulse, severe agitation, altered consciousness, persistent vomiting, severe abdominal pain, acute renal impairment. Pregnancy, children, the frail, and qi/blood or yin-deficient febrile patients should avoid or use extreme caution. Monitor stools, urine output, vital signs, electrolytes and renal function; adjunctive addition of qi-descending/phlegm-transforming herbs (eg Houpo, Zhi Shi) is permissible only when a replete obstructive pattern is confirmed.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 主要經方與君臣佐使功能： 1) 大陷胸湯（常用湯劑）：主藥為大黃、芒硝、甘遂。大黃苦寒，瀉下攻積、清熱破結、活血通腑；芒硝寒苦鹹，潤下軟堅，導水入腸以助瀉並潤滑痰固；甘遂寒苦咸，峻下逐水、消散痰飲與結塊（性峻猛有毒性）。傳統煎法例示：先以水煎大黃取汁，再去滓，納芒硝煮沸數次，最後入甘遂末溫服；方劑劑量按病重增減（經方舉例：大黃六兩、芒硝一升、甘遂少量生用，臨證視病勢調整）。應用要點：適用於熱實結胸、脈沉緊、心下石硬、舌燥渴、五六日不大便或日晡潮熱者。 2) 大陷胸丸（丸劑/收丸法）：方中有大黃、葶藶（炒）、芒硝、杏仁，製丸後另以甘遂末少量入服；丸劑因成形較留滯上焦、較適用於有痰而熱不甚劇烈或需要丸劑緩行者，古方劑量例：大黃半斤、葶藶半升（炒）、芒硝半升、杏仁半升（去皮尖、熬黑），搗篩合研成丸，服法依方別。 3) 小陷胸湯（去痰消結，較緩）：黃連、半夏、栝蔞實三味以黃連清熱，栝蔞破結滑痰，半夏降逆祛水痰，適用於心下按之則痛、脈浮滑、以痰結為主之小結胸。 配伍與加減：如需宣化寬胸、助氣機下行，可兼用厚朴、枳實；痰多需加葶藶、杏仁以利吐痰；濕寒邊緣者先以溫化法（乾薑、炙甘草、白朮、茯苓）調理。 禁忌與注意：孕婦禁用含甘遂、芫花、大戟等峻下逐水藥；兒童、老人、氣血或陰虛者慎用或避免；用藥期間嚴密監測排便次數、尿量、體重、心率血壓及電解質、腎功能；出現脈浮大、極度煩躁、意識改變、劇烈腹痛或急性腎衰等立即停藥並轉急救。臨床原則為：先確定為實邪閉阻、患者有承受力，然後短程強攻並嚴密監護。 / Main classical formulas and herb functions: 1) Da Xian Xiong Tang (decoction): core herbs are Da Huang, Mang Xiao and Gan Sui. Da Huang (cold, bitter) drains accumulations, clears heat, breaks stagnation and opens the bowels; Mang Xiao (cold saline) softens hard stools, draws water into the bowel to facilitate downward discharge and helps move viscous phlegm; Gan Sui (very cold, bitter-salty) forcefully drains water, disperses phlegm-fluid and dissolves masses (potent and potentially toxic). Traditional preparation: boil Da Huang first, remove dregs, add Mang Xiao and boil, then add Gan Sui powder and take warm. Dosages are adjusted to severity (classical examples are large doses; e.g. historical texts list heavy measures—use only under expert supervision). Indications: heat-replete condensed chest pattern with submerged tight pulse, stone-hard epigastric mass, dry mouth/thirst and constipation or tidal fever. 2) Da Xian Xiong Wan (pill): contains Da Huang, Tingli (Tinglizi) processed, Mang Xiao, and Xinren (bitter apricot seed); the pill is formed and Gan Sui powder is administered in a small adjunct dose. Pills tend to remain/stay in the upper burner and are used when a bolus form is preferred (for some water-bound or less violently febrile patterns). Classical pill recipe examples are given in the literature; exact preparation and dosing require experienced practitioners. 3) Xiao Xian Xiong Tang (milder, phlegm-clearing formula): Huang Lian, Ban Xia, Gualou Shi. Huang Lian clears heat/inflammation, Gualou breaks and disperses phlegm-conglomerates, Ban Xia descends rebellious qi and transforms phlegm—suitable for small trapped chest with epigastric pain on pressure, floating-slippery pulse and predominance of phlegm rather than hard water-heat masses. Modifications and adjuncts: add Hou Po and Zhi Shi to promote qi descent and broaden the chest; add Tingli and Xingren to facilitate expectoration; when cold or deficient features predominate, use warming/harmonizing herbs (Gan Cao, Ganjiang, Baizhu, Fuling) rather than powerful purgatives. Contraindications and precautions: pregnancy contraindicated for formulas containing Gan Sui, Yuanhua, Daji and similar strong purgatives; avoid or use extreme caution in children, the elderly, and qi/blood or yin-deficient patients. During therapy closely monitor bowel movements, urine output, vital signs, electrolytes and renal function; stop treatment and seek emergency care for floating-large pulse, severe agitation, persistent vomiting, severe abdominal pain, altered consciousness or acute renal dysfunction. Clinical principle: confirm a true replete obstructive pattern and patient tolerance before short-course aggressive purgation, and perform treatment only under experienced clinical supervision.

syndromes.name: 傷寒 / Shanghan (Cold Damage)
syndromes.description: 廣義上指『傷於寒』之外感性急性病，張仲景以六經辨證（太陽、陽明、少陽、太陰、少陰、厥陰）為主的病機分類與治療原則。 / Broadly refers to externally contracted illnesses caused by cold. Zhang Zhongjing classified these using the Six Channels (Taiyang, Yangming, Shaoyang, Taiyin, Shaoyin, Jueyin) for diagnosis and treatment strategies.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 經典方劑示例：麻黃湯、桂枝湯、白虎湯、小柴胡湯等。 / Example classic formulas: Ma Huang Tang (Ephedra Decoction), Gui Zhi Tang (Cinnamon Twig Decoction), Bai Hu Tang (White Tiger Decoction), Xiao Chai Hu Tang (Minor Bupleurum Decoction).

syndromes.name: 時疫 / Epidemic disease (Shiyi)
syndromes.description: 指不論個人體質，感染後表現出相似群體性病證的外感病，常有同時期多人發病的特徵。 / Refers to epidemic external diseases that produce similar clinical manifestations across people regardless of individual constitution; commonly causes simultaneous outbreaks among many people.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 處方思路與傷寒有重疊，但重視群體防治與解表清熱之法，常用經典解表或清疫方。 / Treatment approach overlaps with Shanghan but emphasizes epidemic control and formulas that release the exterior and clear epidemic toxins; classic formulas for resolving epidemics and clearing heat may be used.

syndromes.name: 太陽病 / Taiyang pattern
syndromes.description: 太陽病為六經之一的表證，以脈浮、頭項強痛、惡寒為核心，常見發熱、或有汗、或無汗等不同表證。依汗出與津液狀態可分為中風（發熱汗出、脈緩）、傷寒（無汗、惡寒、脈緊）、溫病（發熱口渴、熱在表或裡）或風溫（自汗、身灼、津液耗傷）等類型。未及時解表，可向少陽、陽明等裏經傳入，出現裏熱或腑熱。臨床強調以汗解為主（宜慎用發汗法而非以火熏灸取汗）；嚴禁用溫針、灸或以火烘患者取汗，因火攻可致邪由表入裏，造成「火逆」（上煩煩躁、頭汗身不汗、舌咽燥）、病勢延遲不解（到經不解）、吐血或下血等危重證候。《辨太陽病》中多處警示：脈浮熱甚勿灸，微數脈勿灸（虛熱忌灸），發汗應先見煩而後自汗，發汗過度或火熏可致陽浮、津液耗傷與心悸奔豚。總結：太陽證以發汗解表為首要原則，對有虛熱、津液不足或脈象提示內熱者慎用或禁用灸法，按證選方和補益生津以防裏熱與火逆。 / The Taiyang pattern is an exterior syndrome of the Six Channels characterized by a floating pulse, nape/neck stiffness, headache and aversion to cold, often with fever and either presence or absence of sweat. It is subclassified by sweating and fluid status into Zhongfeng (wind-strike: fever with sweating, slow pulse), Shanghan (cold-damage: aversion to cold, no sweat, tight pulse), Wenbing (warm-disease: fever with thirst) or Fengwen (wind-warmth: spontaneous sweating, body burning, fluid depletion). If untreated it may transmit inward to Shaoyang or Yangming producing interior or bowel heat. Clinical principle is to resolve the exterior by inducing sweat; do not substitute with moxibustion/warming needles (fire-application), because applying heat can drive the pathogen inward and cause 'fire reversal' (huo ni) — manifested by agitation, head sweating with body dryness, thirst, delayed course ('daojing bujie'), hematemesis or hematochezia and other severe signs. Textual cautions: when the pulse is floating with marked heat do not moxibust; a fine‑rapid (micro‑rapid) pulse indicates xu-heat and also contraindicates moxibustion. Sweating therapy should be controlled (often vexation precedes spontaneous sweating); excessive sweating or fire‑application risks consuming jin/fluids, producing floating yang, heart vexation and complex inward patterns. In short: use sweating to release the Taiyang exterior, avoid fire‑based methods when there is xu or signs of internal heat, and treat progression to Shaoyang/Yangming according to their patterns while protecting fluids.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 常用方：麻黃湯（無汗、表實兼寒者，以發汗散寒）；桂枝湯（有汗或營衛不和者，以解表和營衛）。溫病或風溫重在益津養液，處方中可加生津藥如沙參、麥冬、生地等，並避免過度發汗或以火熏、溫針取汗。若病勢傳入少陽、陽明，依證加用小柴胡湯或承氣類、白虎類攻裏清熱生津之劑。臨床禁忌與處理：嚴禁用灸或溫針強行取汗（可致火逆、煩躁、到經不解、吐血、下血、奔豚等）；遇火逆或燙針煩躁、頭汗身不汗、脈浮熱盛者，可酌用桂枝加桂湯以振發逼散腸中濁氣，或用桂苓甘草龍骨牡蠣湯等安神鎮陽、生津除煩，並以茯苓利水以助中焦氣化（劑量與加減依證）。 / Common formulas: Ma Huang Tang (Ephedra Decoction) — for exterior cold without sweating to induce sweat and disperse cold; Gui Zhi Tang (Cinnamon Twig Decoction) — for exterior disorders with sweating or ying‑wei disharmony to harmonize. For wenbing or wind‑warmth prioritize fluid‑nourishing and yin‑enriching herbs (e.g., shashen/Glehnia, maidong/Ophiopogon, shengdi/Rehmannia) to protect jin/fluids and avoid excessive induced sweating or local heating. If the disorder transmits to Shaoyang or Yangming, treat per pattern (e.g., Xiao Chaihu Tang for Shaoyang; Chengqi‑type or Bai Hu Tang for Yangming) and add draining/clearing formulas as appropriate. Contraindications and special measures: avoid moxibustion or warming needles to force sweat — fire‑application can cause 'fire reversal' (huo ni) with agitation, head‑only sweating and body dryness, delayed resolution, hematemesis or hematochezia, and other severe signs. In such fire‑reversal or post‑thermal agitation states clinicians may consider guizhi jiagui tang (pinyin) to strongly mobilize yang and disperse intestinal turbidity, or guilinggancao longgu muli tang (pinyin) to calm vexation, settle floating yang and support fluids; add fuling (poria) to resolve retained water when indicated. Dosage and choice must follow the specific pulse and symptom picture and always protect jin/fluids.

syndromes.name: 陽明病 / Yangming pattern
syndromes.description: 六經之一，屬裡實熱位，常見高熱、大渴、煩躁、實滿便秘、脈洪大等陽明熱象。 / A Six Channels pattern representing interior excess heat; commonly presents with high fever, great thirst, irritability, abdominal fullness with constipation, and a large flooding pulse.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 常用方：白虎湯、大承氣湯等清熱瀉實方。 / Common formulas: Bai Hu Tang (White Tiger Decoction), Da Cheng Qi Tang (Major Order the Qi Decoction) for clearing heat and draining excess.

syndromes.name: 少陽病 / Shaoyang pattern
syndromes.description: 六經之一，病位在半表半裡，症見往來寒熱、胸脅苦滿、默默不欲飲食、口苦咽乾、脈弦。 / One of the Six Channels; a half-exterior, half-interior disorder characterized by alternating chills and fever, chest and hypochondriac fullness, poor appetite, bitter taste in the mouth, dry throat, and a wiry pulse.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 常用方：小柴胡湯等和解少陽方。 / Common formulas: Xiao Chai Hu Tang (Minor Bupleurum Decoction) for harmonizing Shaoyang.

syndromes.name: 太陰病 / Taiyin pattern
syndromes.description: 六經之一，多與脾陽虛、痰飲內停有關，表現為腹滿、嘔吐、食少、體倦、便溏等。 / One of the Six Channels often associated with Spleen yang deficiency and internal retention of phlegm-fluid, presenting with abdominal fullness, vomiting, poor appetite, fatigue, and loose stools.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 常用方：理中湯、參苓白術散等補脾暖中、化痰利濕方。 / Common formulas: Li Zhong Tang (Regulate the Middle Decoction), Shen Ling Bai Zhu San (Ginseng, Poria and Atractylodes Powder) to tonify the Spleen, warm the middle, and resolve dampness.

syndromes.name: 少陰病 / Shaoyin pattern
syndromes.description: 六經之一，與心腎虛寒或熱結有關，症狀可表現為畏寒肢冷、心下悸、睡不安或虛熱煩躁等。 / One of the Six Channels related to Heart and Kidney deficiency or internal imbalance; symptoms may include aversion to cold and cold extremities, palpitations, restless sleep, or false heat with irritability.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 常用方：參附湯、歸脾湯等補益心腎、溫養陽氣的方劑。 / Common formulas: Shen Fu Tang variants, Gui Pi Tang (Restore the Spleen Decoction) and other formulas to support Heart-Kidney and warm yang as appropriate.

syndromes.name: 厥陰病 / Jueyin pattern
syndromes.description: 六經之一，為病機最深且變化繁多之經，常見四肢厥冷、嘔逆、躁擾或熱象交錯等複雜表現。 / One of the Six Channels; often the deepest and most complex stage with varied presentations such as cold extremities, vomiting, agitation, or mixed heat-cold signs.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 治療以復陰調營、和解變證為主，方用視病機而定，古方如烏梅丸、四逆湯等可視證選用。 / Treatment focuses on restoring Yin and harmonizing complex transformations; formula selection depends on the pattern. Example classical formulas that may be considered include Wu Mei Wan and Si Ni Tang (depending on manifestations).

syndromes.name: 中風 / Zhongfeng (wind attack)
syndromes.description: 太陽病的一種表證類型，特徵為發熱、汗出、惡風及脈緩，表證有汗而不解者。 / A Taiyang exterior subtype characterized by fever, sweating, aversion to wind and a relaxed pulse; sweating may not relieve the illness.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 常用桂枝湯類解表發汗劑以和營衛，必要時調補津液。 / Often treated with Guizhi-type formulas (e.g., Guizhi Tang) to harmonize ying and wei and induce sweating, with fluid-replenishing herbs as needed.

syndromes.name: 溫病 / Wenbing (warm disease)
syndromes.description: 因先傷寒後轉熱證或因汗液大量流失而表現為發熱、口渴且不惡寒之溫熱病候。 / A warm-disease pattern arising after cold injury or substantial fluid loss, presenting with fever and thirst without aversion to cold.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 以清熱、生津、滋陰為主，兼顧補液以防脫水。 / Treatment focuses on clearing heat and generating fluids (shengjin), nourishing yin and replenishing fluids to prevent dehydration.

syndromes.name: 風溫 / Fengwen (wind-warmth)
syndromes.description: 風溫類型屬於太陽病中津液大損之表熱，表現為自汗出、身灼熱、脈浮以及身重嗜睡等。 / A wind-warmth variant of Taiyang with severe fluid loss presenting as spontaneous sweating, burning body sensation, floating pulse, heaviness and somnolence.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 以解表並兼生津補液為要，並慎用發汗劑；常酌用滋陰生津藥。 / Treatment aims to release the exterior while nourishing fluids; use diaphoresis cautiously and include yin-nourishing, fluid-generating herbs.

syndromes.name: 真寒假熱 / true cold, false heat
syndromes.description: 表現為表面似熱而內裡實寒的證候，常見面頰鮮紅而呼吸不溫、脈浮數而無力等。 / A pattern in which the exterior appears hot while the interior is truly cold; often presents with bright cheeks, cool exhalation, and a floating-rapid yet forceless pulse.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 視證而定，兼顧解表與溫里 / Treatment according to presentation, typically combining releasing the exterior and warming the interior.

syndromes.name: 真熱假寒 / true heat, false cold
syndromes.description: 表面顯示寒冷但裡熱甚重的證候，常見有四肢寒而胸腹熱、舌燥苔黃、脈沉細兼數急等。 / A pattern where the surface appears cold but interior heat is predominant; often shows cold extremities with warm chest/abdomen, dry-yellow tongue coating, and deep thin with rapid pulse.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 視證而定，需同時清裡與護陰 / Treatment individualized; often requires clearing interior heat while protecting yin.

syndromes.name: 桂枝湯證 / Gui Zhi Tang pattern
syndromes.description: 調和營衛、解表與固表，常用桂枝、甘草、生薑、大棗等；甘草能解百毒，助清腸胃之惡物。 / Harmonizes ying and wei, releases the exterior and secures the exterior; commonly includes Guizhi, Gan Cao, Sheng Jiang, and Da Zao; Gan Cao helps 'detoxify' and clear harmful intestinal substances.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 桂枝、甘草、生薑、大棗 / Guizhi (Cinnamon Twig), Gan Cao (Licorice), Sheng Jiang (Fresh Ginger), Da Zao (Jujube)

syndromes.name: 桂枝加葛根湯證 / Gui Zhi Jia Ge Gen Tang pattern
syndromes.name_en: Gui Zhi Jia Ge Gen Tang pattern
syndromes.description: 桂枝加葛根湯證屬太陽表證，特徵為項背強急（頸背肌肉拘緊、活動受限）、頭痛、發熱、汗出、惡風或惡寒兼見者。病機為風邪束肌，致肌中水液凝滯不能升散，停滯於項背則肌肉拘緊；同時營衛不調，陽氣上擠，外有汗出但肌裏仍有凝滯之水。方以葛根升提肌中水氣以舒解項背拘急，桂枝發散肌表以助汗解肌，白芍和桂枝調和營衛、緩急止痛，炙甘草、生薑、大棗補助固表和中。臨床要點：用湯劑、火候偏大以取其發散性；葛根份量較重以達項背；服後應溫覆以促微汗，汗出不宜過甚；若脈浮而緊、無汗者屬表寒實束，不宜用此方（應慎用麻黃類方）；服藥並忌生冷粘滑、葷腥及酒酪等易損中焦者。 / Gui Zhi Jia Ge Gen Tang pattern is a Taiyang exterior disorder characterized by stiff neck and back (rigid, constrained cervical and dorsal muscles), headache, fever, sweating, and aversion to wind (sometimes alternating with chills). Pathomechanism: wind invasion constrains the muscle layer and causes retention/condensation of fluids in the muscles; retained muscle fluids produce rigidity of the nape and back while the ying-wei disharmony permits sweating but fails to resolve the trapped fluids. Ge Gen (kudzu root) is used to raise and mobilize the muscle-level fluids to relieve nape/back rigidity; Gui Zhi (cinnamon twig) disperses the muscle layer and promotes sweating; Bai Shao moderates and harmonizes ying and wei and relieves spasm; Zhi Gan Cao, Sheng Jiang and Da Zao support and protect the middle, preserve fluids and harmonize the formula. Clinical notes: use as a decoction with strong heat to favor dispersal; Ge Gen is used relatively heavy to reach the nape/back; after ingestion cover warmly to produce mild sweating but avoid profuse sweat; if the pulse is floating-tight with no sweating (true exterior cold), this formula is inappropriate (consider mahuang-based therapy); avoid raw/cold, greasy or irritating foods, alcohol and dairy while taking the formula.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 方藥（代表劑型）：桂枝、白芍（等量）、葛根（較重）、炙甘草、生薑、大棗。作用分工：葛根升提肌中水液、解痺、通上部；桂枝發散肌表、壯心陽以助動脈推濶；白芍養血斂陰、緩急止痛、助靜脈回流；炙甘草和中緩急、補益津液；生薑回陽和胃、促腸胃蠕動；大棗補中益氣、保護腸胃津液。配伍要點：桂枝與白芍等量以調陰陽；葛根用量較桂枝增重以確保上達項背；煎法用大火取其氣，服後溫被促微汗，桂枝加葛根湯因葛根升陽較強故不須餐後啜粥；若汗出過多則應減量或停藥；如脈浮緊無汗屬表寒實，忌用此方，須改麻黃類方或按證變方；常見加減：扁桃腺或咽乾加連翹、銀花、浮萍、蟬蛻；面部中風或偏癱重用葛根并配針灸等。 / Formula (typical decoction): Gui Zhi (Cinnamon twig), Bai Shao (White peony) in equal amounts, Ge Gen (Kudzu root) in a heavier dose, Zhi Gan Cao (Honey-fried licorice), Sheng Jiang (Fresh ginger), Da Zao (Jujube). Roles: Ge Gen raises and mobilizes muscle-level fluids, relieves paralysis/bi and clears the upper region; Gui Zhi disperses the muscle layer and supports cardiac yang to promote circulation; Bai Shao nourishes blood, restrains yin, relieves spasm and assists venous return; Zhi Gan Cao harmonizes and moderates, protects qi and fluids; Sheng Jiang restores middle yang, stimulates GI motility and protects the stomach; Da Zao supplements the middle and secures fluids. Formulation notes: Gui Zhi and Bai Shao are equal to balance ying and wei; Ge Gen is used relatively heavier so the action reaches the nape/back; decoct with strong heat to favor dispersal; after dosing cover warmly to induce mild sweating — Gui Zhi Jia Ge Gen Tang, because of Ge Gen's strong ascending action, does not require drinking congee after the dose; reduce or stop if sweating is excessive. Contraindications: a floating-tight pulse without sweating indicates exterior cold and this formula is inappropriate (consider mahuang-type treatment or modify according to signs). Common modifications: add Lian Qiao and Jin Yin Hua etc. for tonsillitis; increase Ge Gen and combine with acupuncture for facial palsy or severe focal bi.

syndromes.name: 桂枝加附子湯證 / Gui Zhi Jia Fu Zi Tang pattern
syndromes.name_en: Gui Zhi Jia Fu Zi Tang pattern
syndromes.description: 發汗過度或表虛兼裡虛，惡風，小便難，四肢微急，難以屈伸，需溫補腎陽以固表。 / After excessive sweating or combined exterior and interior deficiency: aversion to wind, difficulty urinating, slight limb cramps, inability to flex/extend; needs warming kidney yang and securing exterior.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 方用桂枝、芍藥、炙甘草、生薑、大棗、炮附子。 / Formula includes Gui Zhi, Shao Yao, roasted Gan Cao, Sheng Jiang, Da Zao, and prepared Fu Zi (aconite).

syndromes.name: 桂枝去芍藥湯證 / Gui Zhi without Shao Yao Tang pattern
syndromes.name_en: Gui Zhi without Shao Yao Tang pattern
syndromes.description: 太陽病下後出現脈促、胸滿，主證在於血行回流不暢或心陽不足，去芍可避免血回流過快。 / After downward attack in Taiyang disease causing hurried pulse and chest fullness due to altered venous return or cardiac yang deficiency; removing Shao Yao slows venous return.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 方用桂枝、炙甘草、生薑、大棗（去芍藥）。 / Formula uses Gui Zhi, roasted Gan Cao, Sheng Jiang, Da Zao (without Shao Yao).

syndromes.name: 桂枝加厚朴杏仁湯證 / Gui Zhi plus Hou Po and Xing Ren Tang pattern
syndromes.name_en: Gui Zhi plus Hou Po and Xing Ren Tang pattern
syndromes.description: 桂枝加厚朴杏仁湯為桂枝湯之變方，主治外證未解（太陽證未散）而兼喘咳者。臨床以脈浮、表未解或汗出不暢為本，常見咳嗽、微喘、氣短，痰多可為黃稠黏膩或為白沫性痰，舌苔多呈黃膩或白膩。病機多屬痰濕蘊肺或濕熱蘊肺，兼有表邪未解導致氣機不利。方以桂枝調和營衛、芍藥緩急和里、甘草大棗補益，生薑解表和胃；加厚朴以行氣燥濕、降逆利胸膈，杏仁以降氣止咳、潤肺化痰。主治要點：外證未解、脈浮或浮數、表裡夾痰、咳嗽氣喘、痰多（黃稠或白沫）、舌苔黃膩或白膩。禁忌：無表證而為真陰虧耗或純裏寒虛者慎用或禁用。 / Gui Zhi plus Hou Po and Xing Ren Tang is a modification of Gui Zhi Tang indicated when an exterior disorder remains unresolved (Taiyang pattern) with concurrent cough and mild wheezing. Typical findings: floating pulse, unresolved exterior or incomplete sweating, cough with mild dyspnea, sputum that may be thick yellow and greasy or white and foamy, and a yellow‑greasy or white‑greasy tongue coating. Pathomechanism: phlegm‑damp obstructing the Lung, sometimes with heat (damp‑heat) or mixed exterior disorder impeding qi movement. Actions of the formula: Gui Zhi harmonizes ying and wei; Shao Yao moderates and protects the interior; Gan Cao and Da Zao support and harmonize; Sheng Jiang releases the exterior; Hou Po dries damp, promotes qi movement and descends rebellious qi; Xing Ren descends lung qi, stops cough and moistens. Key clinical indications: unresolved exterior with cough/wheeze, floating pulse, profuse sticky sputum (yellow or white‑foamy), greasy tongue coating. Contraindicated in cases of true yin deficiency with dry cough or in patients without an exterior pattern.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 方藥主治與應用要點：桂枝調和營衛，芍藥和里緩急，甘草大棗補中益氣以護正，生薑解表和胃；厚朴行氣燥濕、降逆利胸膈；杏仁降肺氣、潤肺止咳、化痰。臨床加減要點：若以痰熱為主、痰黃濃稠可合清熱化痰藥（例：黃芩、瓜蒌、貝母或連翹）；若以寒濕白沫痰為主可加溫化寒痰藥（例：半夏、乾薑）並重行氣；表虛或陰虛燥咳者宜慎用或酌加滋陰益肺藥。遵從仲景方劑精神，依脈證舌象與汗證輕重調整用藥。 / Herbal notes and clinical use: Actions—Gui Zhi harmonizes ying/wei; Shao Yao moderates and protects the interior; Gan Cao and Da Zao tonify and harmonize; Sheng Jiang releases the exterior and warms the middle; Hou Po moves qi, dries damp and descends rebellious qi; Xing Ren descends lung qi, moistens the lung, and stops cough. Modification tips: if phlegm‑heat predominates with thick yellow sputum, add heat‑clearing and phlegm‑transforming herbs (e.g., Huang Qin, Gua Lou, Bei Mu, Lian Qiao); if cold/dense white foamy phlegm predominates, add warm, phlegm‑transforming herbs (e.g., Ban Xia, Gan Jiang) and emphasize qi movement; if there is pronounced yin or interior deficient dryness, use cautiously or add yin‑nourishing herbs. Follow Zhang Zhongjing’s formulaic principles and adjust according to pulse, tongue, and the degree of exterior involvement.

syndromes.name: 酒客病（胃受損） / alcohol habitué disorder (gastric injury)
syndromes.description: 長期嗜酒導致胃陽不固、胃氣功能受損，舌苔多為濁膩或黃厚，易不耐甘溫濕膩藥物。 / Chronic heavy drinking damages stomach function and stomach yang, often with greasy/yellow tongue coating; patients poorly tolerate sweet, warm or viscous herbs such as jujube in Gui Zhi Tang.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 宜用去濕兼清熱之劑，如葛根芩連湯等，避免含甘厚增濕藥物如紅棗之方。 / Use formulas that resolve dampness and clear heat (e.g., Ge Gen Qin Lian Tang); avoid sweets and viscous herbs like jujube that increase dampness.

syndromes.name: 桂枝麻黃各半湯證 / Gui Zhi and Ma Huang Equal-Halves Tang pattern
syndromes.name_en: Gui Zhi and Ma Huang Equal-Halves Tang pattern
syndromes.description: 表虛而汗不透，面色反熱、身癢、脈微緩欲愈或發作如瘧，需發微汗以解表。 / Exterior pattern where sweating is unresolved with flushed face, skin itching, and slight pulse relaxation; may present intermittent fever and chills—requires mild sweating to release the exterior.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 藥用桂枝、麻黃並行，並配芍藥、甘草、生薑、大棗、杏仁以兼顧潤肺與補中。 / Uses equal parts Gui Zhi and Ma Huang with Shao Yao, Gan Cao, Sheng Jiang, Da Zao, and Xing Ren to release the exterior while supporting fluids.

syndromes.name: 桂枝二麻黃一湯證 / Gui Zhi 2 : Ma Huang 1 Tang pattern
syndromes.name_en: Gui Zhi 2 : Ma Huang 1 Tang pattern
syndromes.description: 病人發熱多於惡寒，日再發者，汗出必解，需加重桂枝以助發表並適度宣肺。 / When fever predominates over chills and there are recurrent daily attacks, needing stronger Gui Zhi relative to Ma Huang to release the exterior and support the lungs.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 方中桂枝量較麻黃為重，配芍藥、麻黃、生薑、杏仁、甘草、大棗。 / Formula increases Gui Zhi relative to Ma Huang and includes Shao Yao, Ma Huang, Sheng Jiang, Xing Ren, Gan Cao, and Da Zao.

syndromes.name: 桂枝二越婢一湯證 / Gui Zhi 2 : Yue Bi 1 Tang pattern
syndromes.name_en: Gui Zhi 2 : Yue Bi 1 Tang pattern
syndromes.description: 太陽病兼有煩躁、脈微弱、熱多寒少，肺熱而津液不足者，宜以石膏并用麻黃清肺降熱並保津。 / Taiyang disease with irritability, feeble pulse, and predominant heat—lung heat with depleted fluids; use gypsum with Ma Huang and Gui Zhi to clear lung heat while preserving fluids.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 方中桂枝、麻黃、石膏、芍藥、甘草、生薑、大棗合用。 / Formula contains Gui Zhi, Ma Huang, Gypsum (Shi Gao), Shao Yao, Gan Cao, Sheng Jiang, and Da Zao.

syndromes.name: 桂枝去桂加茯苓白朮湯證 / Gui Zhi remove Gui plus Fu Ling Bai Zhu Tang pattern
syndromes.name_zh: 桂枝去桂加茯苓白朮湯證
syndromes.name_en: Gui Zhi remove Gui plus Fu Ling Bai Zhu Tang pattern
syndromes.description: 服桂枝湯或攻下後仍有頭項強痛、翕翕發熱、無汗、心下滿、微痛、小便不利等，因中焦濕盛而用以利小便、健脾祛濕。 / Pattern after Gui Zhi Tang or mistaken downward treatment with persistent nape stiffness, intermittent fever, no sweat, epigastric/fullness below the heart, slight pain, and difficult urination; indicates middle‑burner dampness — treated by promoting urination and strengthening spleen to remove dampness.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 芍藥、炙甘草、生薑、茯苓、白朮、大棗 / Shao Yao (Paeonia), Honey‑fried Gan Cao (Licorice), Sheng Jiang (Fresh Ginger), Fu Ling (Poria), Bai Zhu (Atractylodes), Da Zao (Jujube/date)

syndromes.name: 甘草乾薑湯證 / Gan Cao Gan Jiang Tang pattern (Licorice and Dried Ginger Decoction pattern)
syndromes.name_en: Gan Cao Gan Jiang Tang pattern (Licorice and Dried Ginger Decoction pattern)
syndromes.description: 由誤用桂枝湯致裏虛陽衰，出現厥逆、咽中乾、煩躁、吐逆、譫語、腳攣急等，用甘草乾薑湯以復其陽、健脾溫中。 / Pattern caused by mistaken use of Gui Zhi Tang leading to internal deficiency and yang collapse with reversal cold, dry throat, agitation, vomiting, delirium, and leg cramps; treated with Licorice‑Dried Ginger Decoction to restore yang, strengthen spleen, and warm the middle.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 炙甘草、乾薑 / Honey‑fried Licorice, Dried Ginger

syndromes.name: 芍藥甘草湯證 / Shao Yao Gan Cao Tang pattern (Paeonia and Licorice Decoction pattern)
syndromes.name_en: Shao Yao Gan Cao Tang pattern (Paeonia and Licorice Decoction pattern)
syndromes.description: 甘草乾薑湯後若厥愈、足溫但腿仍攣急，需用芍藥甘草湯止攣，使足部功能恢復。 / Pattern following partial recovery with return of warmth to feet but persistent leg cramps; use Shao Yao Gan Cao Decoction to relieve cramps and restore limb function.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 白芍、炙甘草 / Bai Shao (White Paeony), Honey‑fried Licorice

syndromes.name: 調胃承氣湯證 / Tiao Wei Cheng Qi Tang pattern (Regulate the Stomach and Support the Qi Decoction pattern)
syndromes.name_en: Tiao Wei Cheng Qi Tang pattern (Regulate the Stomach and Support the Qi Decoction pattern)
syndromes.description: 胃氣不和、譫語、胸滿、下利或不通大便，伴舌乾、燥裂者，用調胃承氣湯以通導中焦下行。 / Pattern of stomach qi disharmony with delirium, chest fullness, constipation or dysentery-like stools, and dry cracked tongue; treated by regulating the stomach and purging to descend stagnation.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 大黃、炙甘草、芒硝 / Da Huang (Rhubarb), Honey‑fried Licorice, Mang Xiao (Mirabilite)

syndromes.name: 四逆湯證 / Si Ni Tang pattern (Four Reversals Decoction pattern)
syndromes.name_en: Si Ni Tang pattern (Four Reversals Decoction pattern)
syndromes.description: 重發汗或失血後陽氣大傷、手足厥冷、四肢厥逆、下利清穀、小便清利等屬四逆證，用以回陽救逆。 / Pattern of severe yang collapse after over‑sweating or blood loss with cold extremities, reversal cold of limbs, watery diarrhea of unabsorbed food, and clear urination; treated to restore yang and rescue from collapse.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 炙甘草、乾薑、生附子 / Honey‑fried Licorice, Dried Ginger, Raw Aconite (Fuzi)

syndromes.name: 葛根湯證 / Ge Gen Tang pattern (Pueraria Decoction pattern)
syndromes.name_en: Ge Gen Tang pattern (Pueraria Decoction pattern)
syndromes.description: 太陽表證兼有項背強、無汗、惡風、喉嚨痛、口渴、頭痛、身痛等表實證候，或太陽陽明合病伴下利者，用葛根湯解表升陽。 / Taiyang exterior pattern with rigid neck/back, absence of sweat, aversion to wind, sore throat, thirst, headache and body aches; also indicated when Taiyang and Yangming combine producing diarrhea — treated by Ge Gen Tang to release the exterior and raise fluids.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 葛根、麻黃、桂枝、芍藥、炙甘草、生薑、大棗 / Ge Gen (Pueraria), Ma Huang (Ephedra), Gui Zhi (Cinnamon Twig), Shao Yao (Paeonia), Honey‑fried Licorice, Fresh Ginger, Jujube

syndromes.name: 葛根加半夏湯證 / Ge Gen Jia Ban Xia Tang pattern (Ge Gen plus Pinellia Decoction pattern)
syndromes.name_en: Ge Gen Jia Ban Xia Tang pattern (Ge Gen plus Pinellia Decoction pattern)
syndromes.description: 太陽與陽明合病且兼嘔吐或胃內停飲者，用加半夏以止嘔、化水導下。 / Pattern of combined Taiyang‑Yangming disorder with vomiting or retained fluids in stomach; Pinellia is added to stop vomiting and transform retained water.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 葛根、麻黃、桂枝、芍藥、炙甘草、生薑、大棗、生半夏 / Ge Gen, Ma Huang, Gui Zhi, Shao Yao, Honey‑fried Licorice, Fresh Ginger, Jujube, Sheng Ban Xia (raw Pinellia)

syndromes.name: 葛根黃芩黃連湯證 / Ge Gen Huang Qin Huang Lian Tang pattern
syndromes.name_en: Ge Gen Huang Qin Huang Lian Tang pattern
syndromes.description: 桂枝證被誤下導致持續下利、脈促、喘而汗出等，表未解但裏有熱或濕熱者，宜以葛根與黃芩黃連清裡解表並止利。 / Pattern when a Gui Zhi type is mistakenly purged causing persistent diarrhea, rapid pulse, panting and sweating — exterior unresolved while interior heat/damp‑heat exists; treated with Ge Gen plus Huang Qin and Huang Lian to clear interior heat while addressing exterior disorder.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 葛根、炙甘草、黃芩、黃連 / Ge Gen, Honey‑fried Licorice, Huang Qin (Scutellaria), Huang Lian (Coptis)

syndromes.name: 麻黃湯證 / Ma Huang Tang pattern (Ephedra Decoction pattern)
syndromes.name_en: Ma Huang Tang pattern (Ephedra Decoction pattern)
syndromes.description: 受寒傷表之太陽證，頭痛、發熱、身痛、惡風、無汗且喘者，屬麻黃湯證，以發汗解表、利肺宣氣為主。 / Taiyang cold invasion with headache, fever, body and joint aches, aversion to wind, absence of sweat and wheezing; treated with Ma Huang Tang to induce sweating, release the exterior, and relieve lung constriction.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 麻黃、桂枝、炙甘草、杏仁 / Ma Huang (Ephedra), Gui Zhi (Cinnamon Twig), Honey‑fried Licorice, Xing Ren (Apricot Kernel)

syndromes.name: 大青龍湯證 / Da Qing Long Tang pattern (Great Qinglong Decoction)
syndromes.name_en: Da Qing Long Tang pattern (Great Qinglong Decoction)
syndromes.description: 大青龍湯證為表寒裡熱之候，屬太陽傷寒但已內化熱象。主症為脈浮緊，發熱惡寒，身體疼痛，不出汗而煩躁，喉中癢咳，痰黃濃稠或黃濃，舌苔黃濃，或口渴、胃納不佳、小便短赤或小便不利；並可見心下有水氣、胸悶咳喘、或全身沉重、水腫等水氣證。方性為麻黃湯之變方：加生薑、大棗以扶脾胃、養津；加石膏以清肺熱、瀉裡降逆。與麻黃湯關係緊密（麻黃主發汗解表），又與麻杏甘石湯、越婢湯有配伍與證候區別：若胃口尚好且以肺熱為主，常用麻杏甘石湯；越婢湯則着重利尿取小便。臨床用於疫病或季節反常引起的表寒裡熱、肺熱化燥、以及早期肺胸水飲積聚引起的咳喘、身重、水腫等。同時注意禁忌：脈微弱、汗出、惡風者不可服（此為裡虛失津，不宜石膏瀉去陰液），服用不慎可致厥逆、筋惕肉挛等。煎服時常先煮麻黃以減沫並分次服，若汗出過多以溫粉（牡蠣、龍骨、糯米等研粉）擦拭止汗；臨床可依煩躁、發熱、咳嗽痰多等加減石膏或杏仁，對病情轉變須與麻黃湯、小青龍湯等方比較辨證選用。 / Da Qing Long Tang pattern is an exterior-cold with interior-heat syndrome, a Taiyang (exterior) cold that has transformed into internal heat. Principal signs: floating-tense pulse, fever with chills, body aches, absence of sweating with irritability/restlessness, itchy throat with coughing, thick yellow sticky sputum, yellow greasy tongue coating; may also present with thirst, poor appetite, scanty or difficult urination, water accumulation below the chest (xinxia yinqi), cough and slight dyspnea, generalized heaviness or edema. The formula is a modification of Ma Huang Tang: added Sheng Jiang and Da Zao to support the middle and generate fluids, and Shi Gao to clear lung heat and direct heat downward. Relation to other formulas: closely related to Ma Huang Tang (Ma Huang releases the exterior); distinguished from Ma Xing Gan Shi Tang (Ma Xing Gan Shi) — if appetite is good and pulmonary heat predominates, Ma Xing Gan Shi may be preferred; Yue Bi Tang emphasizes promoting urination. Clinically indicated in epidemic disorders or abnormal seasonal shifts causing exterior-cold with interior lung heat, early pulmonary or thoracic fluid accumulation causing cough/shortness of breath, and whole-body heaviness/edema. Contraindications: do not use when the pulse is frail/weak, there is spontaneous sweating, and fan-wind intolerance (脈微弱、汗出、惡風) — these indicate internal deficiency and insufficient fluids; Shi Gao’s cold-draining action and diaphoresis can further harm fluids and cause collapse (cold reversal, muscular spasms). Decoction technique and dosage adjustments are important: Ma Huang is partly directed outward with Xing Ren while part works with Shi Gao downward; increase Shi Gao for high fever/marked irritability, increase Xing Ren for frequent cough or abundant sputum. If excessive sweating occurs after administration, apply warming powder (wenfen) and stop further doses.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 方藥（原方與用法）：麻黃六兩、桂枝二兩（去皮）、甘草二兩（炙）、杏仁五十個（去皮尖）、生薑二兩（切）、大棗十二枚（劈）、石膏如雞子大（碎）。右七味，以水九升，先煮麻黃，減二升，去上沫，內諸藥，煮取三升，去滓，溫服八合，取微似汗；若一服汗多則停服並以溫粉撲之。藥性與加減：麻黃為發表利肺藥，方中一部分與杏仁走表，一部分與石膏走裡；石膏甘寒清熱潤肺、降逆，通常石膏四到五錢為常用量，重症煩躁或高熱可增至一兩；杏仁常用二錢至五錢以降喘化痰，咳嗽頻繁或痰多則加杏仁。臨床變通：若汗出過多用溫粉（牡蠣、龍骨、糯米等等量磨粉）擦拭止汗；若脈微弱、汗出、畏風或素虛者忌用，可改用扶正溫解之方（如桂枝加附子類）。備註：現代臨床常按兩制或錢制換算用量，臨證應依體質與病勢加減。 / Formula (original and administration): Ma Huang (Ephedra) 6 liang, Gui Zhi (Cinnamon twig) 2 liang (peeled), Gan Cao (Licorice, honey-fried) 2 liang, Xing Ren (Apricot seed) 50 seeds (skin/tips removed), Sheng Jiang (Fresh ginger) 2 liang (sliced), Da Zao (Jujube/Chinese date) 12 pieces (halved), Shi Gao (Gypsum) about the size of an egg (crushed). Decoction: use 9 sheng of water, first boil Ma Huang and reduce by 2 sheng, skim foam, add the other herbs and decoct to obtain 3 sheng; strain and take warm 8 he (approximate classical dose) to produce slight sweating; if one dose causes excessive sweating stop further doses and apply warming powder. Actions and modifications: Ma Huang releases the exterior and opens the lung; part of Ma Huang with Xing Ren is directed to the exterior while part with Shi Gao is directed inward; Shi Gao is cooling and clears lung heat—common amount 4–5 qian, may be increased to 1 liang for marked fever/irritability; Xing Ren commonly 2–5 qian—increase for frequent cough or abundant sputum. If excessive sweating occurs use wenfen (warming powder: oystershell, longgu/dragon bone (equine bone), and glutinous rice, equal parts, powdered) to rub and warm. Contraindications: do not use when pulse is frail/weak, there is spontaneous sweating and wind aversion (indicating interior deficiency); such patients need supportive-warming prescriptions (e.g., Gui Zhi with Fuzi) rather than Da Qing Long Tang. Adjust doses according to constitution and severity in modern practice.

syndromes.name: 小青龍湯證 / Xiao Qing Long Tang pattern (Minor Qinglong Decoction)
syndromes.name_en: Xiao Qing Long Tang pattern (Minor Qinglong Decoction)
syndromes.description: 證候概述：表裏俱寒，外感寒邪束表而內有水飲停聚，主要表現為心下有水氣（胃脘悶滿、上衝感）、咳嗽吐白色泡沫痰、氣喘咳嗽、喉中癢或咳而舒適、可有微熱但多不渴，舌苔多白，脈多浮或浮細；兼見小便清白或小便不利、少腹脹滿、乾嘔等。病機：外寒不解同時內寒夾飲，寒束肺胃、津液凝滯上逆成痰飲。治則：解表化飲、溫肺散寒、降逆止咳、和中安胃。與大青龍湯比較：小青龍湯為表裡俱寒、痰為清白泡沫，病人常素體偏寒、發汗後可見口渴；大青龍湯為表寒裏熱、痰黃黏稠並伴煩渴、舌苔黃濁。臨床加減要點：若服方後覺渴者，表示裡寒去欲解，可加生津藥；若有明顯口渴，方中可去半夏、加栝蔞根（3兩）；若微下利（輕瀉）去麻黃，加芫花少許以止瀉（如雞子大，熬令赤色）；若噫氣嚴重，去麻黃，加炮附子一枚；若小便不利、少腹滿，去麻黃，加茯苓4兩；喘甚時常須加杏仁而不必去麻黃（後世有去麻黃加杏仁之法，但臨證需慎）。注意：細辛性熱、有毒，臨床用量慎小；服湯時若汗出過多以炙甘草助收；體虛汗多者慎用發汗藥。 / Pattern summary: Concurrent exterior and interior cold with internal water accumulation. Key signs: epigastric (substernal) water sensation, cough with expectoration of white foamy sputum, wheezy cough, itchy throat, possible low-grade fever without thirst, tongue with white coating, pulse floating or fine. Pathomechanism: exterior cold not resolved with cold-induced retention of fluids in Lung and Stomach producing phlegm-fluid that ascends and causes coughing/retching. Treatment principle: release the exterior and transform fluids, warm the Lung and disperse cold, descend rebellious qi and stop cough, harmonize the Middle. Contrast with Da Qing Long Tang: Xiao Qing Long is for exterior-and-interior cold with white frothy sputum and often a constitutionally cold patient who may become thirsty after fluids are driven off; Da Qing Long Tang treats exterior cold with interior heat, yellow sticky sputum, thirst and irritability. Key modifications: if thirst appears after dosing, representatory cold is resolving and add yin- or fluid-restoring herbs; if patient is thirsty initially remove Ban Xia and add Gua Lou Gen 3 liang; if slight diarrhea (mild stool loosening) remove Ma Huang and add a small amount of Yuan Hua (about size of an egg to decoct to red); if persistent hiccup/eructation remove Ma Huang and add processed Fuzi 1 piece; if urinary difficulty or lower abdominal fullness remove Ma Huang and add Fu Ling 4 liang; for severe wheeze consider adding Xing Ren (apricot kernel) — clinical judgment required. Note: Xi Xin is hot and toxic; use small dose; monitor for over-sweating and avoid powerful diaphoresis in deficient patients.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 方藥（原方及作用）：麻黃三兩（發汗解表、宣肺平喘、利水）；芍藥三兩（養營斂肝、調和桂枝以緩筋緊）；細辛三兩（溫化寒飲、通陽散寒，性熱有毒，臨用量宜小）；乾薑三兩（溫中散寒、溫肺化飲）；甘草三兩（炙，和中緩急、收斂回陽、止咳調和諸藥）；桂枝三兩（發汗解表、溫經通陽）；五味子半斤（收斂止咳、斂肺固表、生津止嘔）；半夏半升（洗，燥濕化痰、降逆止嘔，需處理以減毒）。加減要點：若有口渴，去半夏，加栝蔞根3兩；若微利（輕瀉），去麻黃，加芫花少許（如雞子大，熬令赤色）；若噫氣（打嗝、上逆）去麻黃，加炮附子1枚；若小便不利、少腹滿，去麻黃，加茯苓4兩；若喘甚可加杏仁（半升，去皮尖），臨床視體質與證候酌減增減。注意事項：細辛毒性、麻黃發汗利水力強，氣虛津虧者慎用；汗出過多以炙甘草、保溫止汗。 / Herbs (original formula and functions): Ma Huang (Ephedra) 3 liang – induces sweating, opens the exterior, disseminates Lung, relieves wheeze and mobilizes water; Shao Yao (Paeonia) 3 liang – moderates spasms, harmonizes with Gui Zhi and protects fluids; Xi Xin (Asarum) 3 liang – warms and dispels cold from the interior, opens orifices (hot and toxic, use minimal dose); Gan Jiang (Dried ginger) 3 liang – warms the Middle, restores Yang, warms Lung to transform cold-fluid; Gan Cao (Licorice, honey-fried) 3 liang – harmonizes formula, moderates harshness, helps stop excessive sweating and supports Middle; Gui Zhi (Cinnamon twig) 3 liang – releases the exterior, warms channels; Wu Wei Zi (Schisandra) 1/2 jin – astringes the Lung, stops cough and generates fluids; Ban Xia (Pinellia, washed) 1/2 sheng – dries damp, transforms phlegm, descends rebellious qi and relieves nausea (must be prepared/wash to reduce toxicity). Common modifications: if thirsty remove Ban Xia and add Gua Lou Gen (Trichosanthes root) 3 liang; if slight diarrhea remove Ma Huang and add a small amount of Yuan Hua (Genkwa flower) (size of an egg, decoct until red); if persistent belching/hiccough remove Ma Huang and add processed Fuzi (Aconite) one piece; if urinary difficulty or lower abdominal fullness remove Ma Huang and add Fu Ling 4 liang; for marked wheeze consider adding Xing Ren (Apricot kernel) (clinically often Ma Huang is retained). Cautions: Xi Xin is toxic; Ma Huang strongly induces sweating and fluid mobilization so avoid in qi/yin-deficient patients with spontaneous sweating; if sweating is excessive use roasted licorice and rewarm the patient.

syndromes.name: 小柴胡湯證 / Xiao Chai Hu Tang pattern (Minor Bupleurum Decoction)
syndromes.name_en: Xiao Chai Hu Tang pattern (Minor Bupleurum Decoction)
syndromes.description: 小柴胡湯證為少陽（半表半裏）證，病機為邪鬱少陽，表裏不和，三焦氣機不暢，肝膽鬱熱或胃脾津液不足所致。主症：往來寒熱或寒熱互見，胸脘或心下、兩脅脹滿苦悶，脈多弦（或弦細），默默不欲食、心煩喜嘔或微噁，兼見口渴、小便不利、咳嗽、潮熱、乏力等。婦人常見於感冒或傷寒後月經來或停時出現熱入血室、往來寒熱、胸脅下滿如結胸者，小柴胡湯主之。治則和解少陽，疏散鬱熱，扶正和中。注意事項：若太陽與少陽併病且有頭項強痛、眩冒、似結胸、譫語或心下痞硬甚者忌服小柴胡湯，宜先刺大椎、肺俞、肝俞以泄太陽或刺期門瀉肝膽之熱；若為寒實結胸、臟結或津液大傷（舌苔白滑、脈沉微或無汗、極度虛弱）則不可誤用，必要時改用相應攻堅或溫中扶正之法。 / Xiao Chai Hu Tang pattern is a Shaoyang (half‑exterior, half‑interior) disorder caused by constraint of pathogenic qi in the Shaoyang with disharmony between the exterior and interior, blocked Sanjiao flow, and often liver/gallbladder stagnation or middle Jiao fluid deficiency. Core manifestations: alternating or intermittent fever and chills, epigastric/epigastric-hypochondrial distention and discomfort, a commonly wiry (sometimes wiry‑thin) pulse, low appetite, irritability with nausea or occasional vomiting, and possible thirst, urinary difficulty, cough, tidal fever, and fatigue. In women it commonly appears after an attack of cold/fever around menses as “heat entering the blood chamber” producing alternating chills and fever and hypochondriac fullness—Xiao Chai Hu Tang is indicated. Treatment principle: harmonize the Shaoyang, release the half‑exterior/half‑interior, disperse constrained heat, and support the middle Jiao. Cautions: if Taiyang and Shaoyang are concurrently involved with severe neck/occipital rigidity, dizziness, fixed chest pain or delirium, Xiao Chai Hu Tang is contraindicated—first drain Taiyang (e.g., bloodletting at Dazhui, needling Feishu/Ganshu) or needle Qimen to discharge liver/gallbladder heat; do not use for cold‑accumulation chest binding or when fluids are severely depleted (white slippery coating, deep faint pulse), and select appropriate purgative/attack or warming/support formulas instead.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 君藥：柴胡——和解少陽、疏肝理氣；臣藥：黃芩——清裡熱、去火；佐藥：半夏——降逆止嘔、化痰（有口渴者慎用）；佐使：人參或黨參——補中益氣以扶正；甘草——調和諸藥、緩急解毒；生薑——和中止嘔；大棗——補養脾胃、助藥性。常用加減：胸中煩而不嘔可去半夏、加栝蔞實；口渴明顯者去半夏、加人參與栝蔞根；兩脅痞硬或腫塊可加牡蠣、桃仁以軟堅破瘀；小便不利加茯苓；咳嗽時可去人參大棗改用五味子等收肺止咳。臨床變用：若太陽與少陽夾雜，或表證仍重者宜用柴胡桂枝湯（加重柴胡、合用桂枝、人參、黃芩、芍藥、半夏、甘草、大棗、生薑）；發汗復下、裏虛寒濕、胸脅滿者常用柴胡桂枝乾薑湯（加乾薑、栝蔞根、牡蠣、炙甘草等）以溫中達表、補津導濕。禁忌與警示：寒實結胸不可用小柴胡湯，寒實結胸為三物小白散或攻堅方（含巴豆、桔梗、貝母等）處理；病人津液虧損、舌唇乾裂、無汗或虛弱者慎用或減劑量；若伴嚴重神志異常或胸脅劇痛，應先行刺大椎、肺俞、肝俞或期門疏泄再議用方。 / Chief: Chai Hu (Bupleurum) — harmonizes Shaoyang, soothes constrained qi. Deputy: Huang Qin (Scutellaria) — clears interior heat. Assistant: Ban Xia (Pinellia) — descends rebellious qi, stops vomiting, transforms phlegm (use cautiously if patient is thirsty). Aiding agents: Ren Shen or Dang Shen (Ginseng/Codonopsis) — tonify the middle Jiao and support upright qi; Gan Cao (Licorice) — harmonizes the formula and moderates toxicity; Sheng Jiang (fresh ginger) — warms center, stops retching; Da Zao (jujube) — tonifies spleen and harmonizes. Common modifications: if vexation without vomiting, remove Ban Xia and add Gua Lou Shi (Trichosanthes seed); with marked thirst remove Ban Xia and add Ren Shen plus Gua Lou gen (root); for hypochondrial hardness or masses add Mu Li (Oyster shell) and Tao Ren (Peach kernel) to soften hardness and break stasis; for urinary difficulty add Fu Ling (Poria); for cough replace Ren Shen/Da Zao with Wu Wei Zi (Schisandra) or other astringents. Clinical variants: when Taiyang signs persist or co‑exist increase Chai Hu and use Chai Hu Gui Zhi Tang (Chai Hu + Gui Zhi combination) — contains Chai Hu, Gui Zhi, Huang Qin, Ren Shen, Shao Yao, Ban Xia, Gan Cao, Da Zao, Sheng Jiang; after sweating and purging with middle Jiao weakness use Chai Hu Gui Zhi Gan Jiang Tang (adds Gan Jiang, Gua Lou gen, Mu Li, zhi Gan Cao) to warm the center, restore fluids and open the exterior. Contraindications/warnings: do not use Xiao Chai Hu Tang for cold‑accumulation chest binding (coldshi jiexiong)—these require three‑ingredient “white” powders or aggressive purgative/attack formulas (e.g., Ba Dou combinations); avoid or reduce dose if body fluids are severely depleted (dry cracked lips, no sweating, extreme weakness). If severe neurological signs, fixed chest pain, or marked occipital/neck rigidity occur, first drain Taiyang points (Dazhui, Feishu, Ganshu) or needle Qimen to discharge hepatic heat before deciding on the formula.

syndromes.name: 桂枝湯加葛根證 / Gui Zhi Tang plus Ge Gen pattern
syndromes.name_en: Gui Zhi Tang plus Ge Gen pattern
syndromes.description: 表未解且汗出不澈者，加葛根以升陽解肌、助津液以助汗出。 / When Gui Zhi Tang pattern has imperfect sweating, add Ge Gen to raise yang and release the muscle layer while supporting body fluids to aid sweating.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 桂枝湯加葛根（方中増用葛根） / Gui Zhi Tang plus Ge Gen (addition of Pueraria root)

syndromes.name: 小建中湯加黃耆證 / Xiao Jian Zhong Tang plus Huang Qi pattern
syndromes.name_en: Xiao Jian Zhong Tang plus Huang Qi pattern
syndromes.description: 下焦或裏虛明顯者，用小建中湯補中、和里，加黃耆固表補氣，適用於裏虛而需發汗者。 / For patients with underlying interior deficiency, use Xiao Jian Zhong Tang to tonify the center and harmonize the interior, adding Huang Qi to consolidate the exterior and augment qi when sweating is needed.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 小建中湯加黃耆（飴糖或方糖作補） / Xiao Jian Zhong Tang plus Huang Qi (adding maltose or sugar as tonic)

syndromes.name: 乾薑附子湯證 / Gan Jiang Fu Zi Tang pattern (Dry Ginger and Aconite Decoction)
syndromes.name_en: Gan Jiang Fu Zi Tang pattern (Dry Ginger and Aconite Decoction)
syndromes.description: 下後復發汗、白天煩躁不得眠、夜而安靜、脈沉微者，主以乾薑附子湯救陽回陽。 / After purgation with recurrent exterioring, daytime agitation with insomnia, night calm, and a deep-faint pulse indicate Gan Jiang Fu Zi Tang pattern to urgently rescue yang.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 方：乾薑一兩，附子一枚（生用，去皮破八片）。以水三升，煮取一升，頓服。 / Formula: Gan Jiang 1 liang, raw Fu Zi 1 piece (peeled, split into 8); decoct in 3 sheng water to 1 sheng, take as one dose.

syndromes.name: 營衛不和 / Ying-Wei disharmony
syndromes.description: 營衛失調，表現為時發熱自汗出，病久不愈，為桂枝湯所主。 / Disharmony between nutritive (ying) and protective (wei) qi, presenting with intermittent fever and spontaneous sweating that does not resolve; treated by Gui Zhi Tang.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 桂枝湯：桂枝、白芍、生薑、甘草、大棗等（以湯劑調和營衛）。 / Gui Zhi Tang: cinnamon twig, peony, fresh ginger, licorice, jujube (decoction to harmonize ying and wei).

syndromes.name: 桂枝加芍藥生薑人參新加湯證 / Guizhi plus Shaoyao Shengjiang Renshen (Xinjia Tang) pattern
syndromes.name_zh: 桂枝加芍藥生薑人參新加湯證
syndromes.name_en: Guizhi plus Shaoyao Shengjiang Renshen (Xinjia Tang) pattern
syndromes.description: 發汗過多後，身體疼痛、四肢末端疼痛，脈沉遲，因津液傷損，宜用本方補回津液、和營衛。 / After excessive sweating with body aches, distal limb pain, and deep-slow pulse due to fluid loss; use this formula to restore fluids and harmonize Ying-Wei.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 桂枝、芍藥、生薑、人參、甘草、大棗等（新加湯加重芍藥與人參）。 / Guizhi, Shaoyao, Shengjiang, Renshen, Gancao, Dazao (Xinjia Tang with increased Shaoyao and Renshen).

syndromes.name: 桂枝甘草湯證 / Guizhi Gancao Tang pattern
syndromes.description: 發汗過多後心下悸，患者欲按壓心下且按之可緩，宜桂枝甘草湯和解胃中之陽虛。 / After excessive sweating with epigastric palpitation relieved by pressing, treat with Guizhi Gancao Tang to harmonize and restore gastric yang.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 桂枝、甘草二味。 / Guizhi (Cinnamomi Ramulus) and Gancao (Licorice).

syndromes.name: 茯苓桂枝甘草大棗湯證 / Fuling Guizhi Gancao Dazao Tang pattern
syndromes.name_zh: 茯苓桂枝甘草大棗湯證
syndromes.name_en: Fuling Guizhi Gancao Dazao Tang pattern
syndromes.description: 發汗後臍下悸、欲作奔豚者，主於下焦水上衝，宜用茯苓、桂枝、甘草、大棗以利水和中。 / After sweating with lower-abdominal palpitation and tendency toward running-piglet, indicating lower burner water surging upward; use Fuling, Guizhi, Gancao, Dazao to drain and harmonize.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 茯苓、桂枝、甘草、大棗等。 / Fuling (Poria), Guizhi, Gancao, Dazao.

syndromes.name: 厚朴生薑半夏甘草人參湯證 / Houpo Shengjiang Banxia Gancao Renshen Tang pattern
syndromes.name_zh: 厚朴生薑半夏甘草人參湯證
syndromes.name_en: Houpo Shengjiang Banxia Gancao Renshen Tang pattern
syndromes.description: 發汗後腹脹滿、嗳氣放屁或大便不暢，分虛實，虛脹宜本方以厚朴降氣、半夏降逆、補脾胃。 / Post-sweating abdominal distention with belching and flatulence; for deficient distention use this formula to descend qi, suppress counterflow, and tonify spleen-stomach.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 厚朴、生薑、半夏、甘草、人參等。 / Houpo (Magnolia), Shengjiang, Banxia (Pinellia), Gancao, Renshen.

syndromes.name: 芍藥甘草附子湯證 / Shao Yao Gancao Fuzi Tang pattern
syndromes.name_en: Shao Yao Gancao Fuzi Tang pattern
syndromes.description: 發汗後病不解反惡寒，素虛畏寒或四肢厥冷者，宜芍藥甘草附子湯以補血、溫陽、回陽止冷。 / After sweating with unresolved illness and returning aversion to cold in deficient patients with cold extremities; treat with Shaoyao Gancao Fuzi Tang to nourish blood and warm yang.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 芍藥、甘草、附子等。 / Shao Yao (Paeonia), Gancao, Fuzi (Aconite).

syndromes.name: 茯苓四逆湯證 / Fuling Sini Tang pattern
syndromes.description: 發汗或下之後出現煩躁、四肢四逆（手足冰冷）、脈微弱或沉細，陰陽兩虛者可用。 / After sweating or purging with persistent vexation, cold extremities (four reversals), and weak/faint pulse indicating yang deficiency or combined deficiency; use Fuling Sini Tang to restore yang and drain water.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 茯苓、人參、附子、甘草、乾薑等。 / Fuling, Renshen, Fuzi, Gancao, Ganjiang.

syndromes.name: 茯苓桂枝白朮甘草湯證 / Fuling Guizhi Baizhu Gancao Tang pattern
syndromes.name_zh: 茯苓桂枝白朮甘草湯證
syndromes.name_en: Fuling Guizhi Baizhu Gancao Tang pattern
syndromes.description: 吐下傷胃後心下逆滿、氣上衝胸、起則頭眩、脈沉緊、發汗則動經，身體振搖者，宜本方利水健脾安中。 / After vomiting and purging causing epigastric counterflow fullness, qi rushing to chest and vertigo on standing with deep-tense pulse and trembling on movement; use this formula to resolve water retention, strengthen the spleen, and calm the middle.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 茯苓、桂枝、白朮、甘草等。 / Fuling, Guizhi, Baizhu, Gancao.

syndromes.name: 五苓散證 / Wuling San pattern
syndromes.description: 五苓散證屬水濕停聚之證。常因發汗後表邪未解或以冷水潑身、津液未能回入中焦，致水飲停聚於表與三焦，氣化失司。主症為小便不利或尿少，表面浮腫（面眼浮腫或全身浮腫），脈浮或脈浮數，低熱或微熱，口渴或消渴（欲飲水以利水），有時身重倦怠、胸脅痞滿、晨起腫重午間漸減。舌苔多見白滑或薄膩。若僅表水停聚、意欲飲水但不渴者可用文蛤散；若症未解或小便仍不利，則以五苓散利水為主。 / Wuling San pattern is a water-damp retention syndrome. It often follows sweating or improper cooling (e.g., being doused with cold water) when body fluids fail to return to the middle jiao, causing water to accumulate in the exterior and the three jiaos and impair fluid transformation. Key signs are scanty urination or urinary difficulty, superficial edema (facial/ periorbital or generalized edema), a floating (sometimes rapid) pulse, low-grade fever, and thirst (drinking to promote urination). Patients may feel heaviness, malaise, or chest/ hypochondrial fullness; edema is often worse in the morning and improves toward midday. Tongue coating tends to be white and slippery or thin-greasy. If the condition is a simple exterior water accumulation with desire to drink but no true thirst, Wen Ge San may be used; when urination remains difficult and the exterior water must be mobilized and diuresed, Wuling San is indicated.
syndromes.herbal_treatments:
方藥及作用：
- 豬苓：利水滲濕，通利小便，助排膀胱水飲。
- 澤瀉：瀉下利水、泄腎經之濕熱，利小便而降水泛之盛。
- 茯苓：健脾滲濕，利水滲濕兼安神，扶助脾的運化水濕功能。
- 桂枝：解表助陽，溫通衛表，使表水回輸以利小便；助調營衛促水機化行。
- 白朮：健脾燥濕、固表止汗，助脾運化水濕、防止水氣回陷。 / Formula herbs and actions:
- Zhu Ling (Polyporus): promotes urination and drains dampness, facilitating bladder excretion of retained fluids.
- Ze Xie (Alisma): drains damp and clears through the lower jiao, promotes urination and resolves water accumulation.
- Fu Ling (Poria): strengthens the spleen and leaches out damp, supporting fluid transformation and calming the mind.
- Gui Zhi (Cinnamon twig): releases the exterior and harmonizes the nutritive and protective qi, helps mobilize superficial fluids so they can be diuresed.
- Bai Zhu (Atractylodes): tonifies the spleen and dries damp, consolidates the exterior and restores spleen transportive function.

syndromes.name: 茯苓甘草湯證 / Fuling Gancao Tang pattern
syndromes.description: 以心下悸或中焦飲停所致的心悸、四肢乏力為主，重在利水健脾以止悸。 / Pattern treated by Fuling Gancao Tang marked by epigastric palpitations and diminished qi/weakness due to retained fluids in the middle jiao; emphasis on diuresis and strengthening the spleen to relieve palpitations.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 茯苓、桂枝、生薑、炙甘草 / Fu Ling (Poria), Gui Zhi (Cinnamon twig), Sheng Jiang (Fresh ginger), Zhi Gan Cao (Prepared licorice)

syndromes.name: 梔子豉湯證 / Zhizi Chi Tang pattern
syndromes.description: 發汗吐下後餘熱未清、虛煩不得眠、心中懊惱或胸中窒悶等虛熱症候的調理方證。 / Pattern for post-sweating/vomiting/defecation residual heat with deficiency vexation, insomnia, irritability, or chest oppression; a restorative formula to clear lingering heat and calm the mind.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 梔子、豆豉（香豉） / Zhi Zi (Gardenia), Fermented Soybean (Douchi)

syndromes.name: 梔子甘草豉湯證 / Zhizi Gancao Chi Tang pattern
syndromes.description: 梔子豉湯加甘草，用於虛煩伴少氣、四肢無力或食後嘔吐之情形，重在補中緩煩。 / Variant of Zhizi Chi Tang with added licorice for deficiency vexation accompanied by shortness of breath, weakness, or nausea after eating; focuses on tonifying the middle and relieving vexation.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 梔子、甘草、豆豉 / Zhi Zi (Gardenia), Gan Cao (Licorice), Fermented Soybean (Douchi)

syndromes.name: 梔子生薑豉湯證 / Zhizi Shengjiang Chi Tang pattern
syndromes.description: 梔子豉湯加生薑，用於發汗吐下後伴嘔吐或胃氣不降者，以和胃降逆止嘔為主。 / Variant of Zhizi Chi Tang with added fresh ginger for post-treatment nausea or failure of stomach qi to descend; harmonizes the stomach and stops vomiting.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 梔子、生薑、豆豉 / Zhi Zi (Gardenia), Sheng Jiang (Fresh ginger), Fermented Soybean (Douchi)

syndromes.name: 水逆 / Shui Ni (water reversal)
syndromes.description: 表裏不和或陽氣上浮導致下焦水上逆，病人渴而飲水則吐，呈水上逆胃中不受之象。 / Disharmony where yang rises and fluids are drawn upward causing lower-jiao fluids to reverse; patients thirst but vomit on drinking, indicating fluids cannot be received by the stomach.

syndromes.name: 梔子厚朴枳實湯證 / Zhizi Houpo Zhishi Tang pattern
syndromes.description: 傷寒下後出現心煩、腹滿、臥起不安，屬虛煩兼有局部結實與脹氣者所見之證。 / Pattern after Shanghan with vexation, abdominal fullness, and unrest on lying/rising; deficiency vexation with focal binding and trapped intestinal gas.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 方：梔子十四枚，厚朴四兩，枳實四枚。以水三升半，煮取一升半，分二服。 / Formula: Zhizi 14 pieces, Hou Po 4 liang (fried), Zhi Shi 4 pieces; decoct in 3.5 sheng of water to yield 1.5 sheng, two doses.

syndromes.name: 梔子乾薑豉湯證 / Zhizi Ganjiang Chi Tang pattern
syndromes.description: 攻下大便已行而身熱不解、微煩，舌苔薄白、脈微弱，為腸胃虛寒需溫中者。 / After purgation with persistent body heat and slight vexation, thin white coating and weak pulse indicating gastrointestinal cold deficiency requiring warming the center.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 方：梔子十四枚，乾薑二兩，香豉四合；以水三升，煮取一升半，分二服。 / Formula: Zhizi 14 pieces, dried ginger 2 liang, fragrant fermented soy (xiang chi) 4 he; decoct in 3 sheng water to yield 1.5 sheng, two doses.

syndromes.name: 真武湯證 / Zhenwu Tang pattern
syndromes.description: 發汗後汗出不解而見身熱、心下悸、頭眩、身體震顫、振振欲擗地，兼有津液不足與水飲內停者。 / After sweating with unresolved symptoms, presenting with fever, epigastric palpitations, dizziness, body tremor, and sinking/floaty sensation; due to water accumulation and fluid depletion.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 方：茯苓三兩，芍藥三兩，生薑三兩，白朮二兩，附子一枚；以水八升，煮取三升，溫服。 / Formula: Fu Ling 3 liang, Shao Yao 3 liang, Sheng Jiang 3 liang, Bai Zhu 2 liang (fried), Fuzi 1 piece; decoct and warm for administration.

syndromes.name: 麥門冬湯證 / Mai Men Dong Tang pattern
syndromes.description: 以咽喉乾燥、口渴為主的咽喉陰虛證，需潤肺滋陰以養津液者。 / Pattern of throat dryness and thirst due to yin deficiency of the throat and lungs, requiring lung-nourishing and fluid-restoring therapy.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 主方：麥門冬湯，主藥為麥門冬，方中以潤肺滋陰為旨。 / Mai Men Dong Tang: centered on Mai Men Dong (Ophiopogon) to moisten the lungs and nourish yin.

syndromes.name: 淋家 / Lin-type patients (strangury-prone)
syndromes.description: 指素有小便異常（石淋、膏淋或血淋）者，遇發汗反易傷陰而致出血或症情惡化，故不可發汗。 / Patients prone to urinary strangury (stone, turbid, or bloody types); sweating may further damage yin and provoke bleeding or worsen the condition, thus sweating is contraindicated.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 常用方：豬苓湯等利水清熱方以利小便。 / Common treatment: Zhu Ling Tang and other diuretic/heat-clearing formulas to promote urination.

syndromes.name: 瘡家 / Sore/ulcer-type patients
syndromes.description: 指有外科瘡瘍的病人，已化膿者忌發汗，未化膿者可用解表藥助其排膿出表。 / Patients with sores or ulcers: if suppurated, sweating is contraindicated; if not yet suppurated, releasing the exterior may help bring pus to the surface.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 臨證可用小建中湯溫補或小柴胡湯調和，未破潰者可用發表藥促表達。 / Clinically may use Xiao Jian Zhong Tang for gentle warming or Xiao Chai Hu Tang to harmonize; exterior-releasing herbs indicated prior to suppuration.

syndromes.name: 衄家 / Epistaxis-prone patients
syndromes.description: 素有鼻衄之人，發汗易使額上三陽經氣血失養而加重出血與陰虛失眠，故不可任意發汗。 / Patients prone to frequent nosebleeds; sweating can exacerbate bleeding by further depleting blood and yin, causing dizziness and insomnia, therefore sweating is contraindicated.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 處置方例：黃連阿膠雞子黃湯或小柴胡湯等以苦寒降虛熱並滋養陰血。 / Treatment examples: Huanglian Ejiao Jizi Huang Tang or Xiao Chai Hu Tang to reduce deficient heat and nourish yin/blood.

syndromes.name: 亡血家 / bleeding-depleted patients
syndromes.description: 指因失血造成素虛、面色蒼白、怕冷顫慄等陰虛證候者，忌用發散發汗藥，當以回陽、補血為先。 / Patients depleted by bleeding presenting with pallor, cold intolerance and shivering from deficiency; avoid dispersing/sweating therapies and prioritize restoring yang and blood.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 治法：人參四逆湯、附子理中湯或小建中湯佐蔥豉等以回陽補血並慎和表。 / Approach: use Ren Shen Si Ni Tang, Fuzi Lizhong Tang, or Xiao Jian Zhong Tang with scallion and fermented soy to restore yang and blood while cautiously harmonizing the exterior.

syndromes.name: 汗家 / sweat-prone patients
syndromes.description: 平素易自汗或汗多者，重發汗會消耗津液而致心神恍惚、胃中津液枯竭並兼見小便短赤等症，發汗應慎之。 / People who habitually sweat easily; excessive additional sweating depletes fluids leading to mental confusion, exhausted gastric fluids, and possible shortened/dark urination, so sweating should be used cautiously.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 調治可用溫和補益如人參、甘草、生薑、紅棗等以固衛補津，或仿桂枝湯法少量發汗。 / Management: gentle tonics such as ginseng, licorice, ginger, and jujube to restore fluids, or adopt a mild sweating method modeled on Gui Zhi Tang to avoid overexertion.

syndromes.name: 白虎湯證 / Bai Hu Tang pattern
syndromes.description: 陽明熱盛之證，以大熱大渴、汗多、脈洪大為主。 / Yangming heat pattern characterized by high fever, great thirst, profuse sweating, and a large flooding pulse.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 石膏、知母、粳米、炙甘草 / Gypsum (Shi Gao), Anemarrhena (Zhi Mu), Japonica rice (Geng Mi), honey-fried Licorice (Zhi Gan Cao)

syndromes.name: 人參白虎湯證 / Ren Shen Bai Hu Tang pattern
syndromes.name_en: Ren Shen Bai Hu Tang pattern
syndromes.description: 白虎證兼胃陰不足者，加入人參以益胃陰、復脾胃之津液。 / Bai Hu pattern with stomach-yin deficiency; Ren Shen is added to nourish stomach yin and restore stomach fluids.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 人參、石膏、知母、粳米、炙甘草 / Ginseng (Ren Shen), Gypsum (Shi Gao), Anemarrhena (Zhi Mu), Japonica rice (Geng Mi), honey-fried Licorice (Zhi Gan Cao)

syndromes.name: 柴胡湯證 / Chai Hu Tang pattern
syndromes.description: 疏解少陽、和解表裏之證，常見胸脅不舒、往來寒熱或口苦等。 / Pattern of harmonizing the Shaoyang, relieving constraint between exterior and interior; often presents with hypochondriac discomfort, alternating chills and fever, or bitter taste.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 柴胡、黃芩、半夏、生薑、大棗、甘草、人參 / Bupleurum (Chai Hu), Scutellaria (Huang Qin), Pinellia (Ban Xia), Fresh Ginger (Sheng Jiang), Jujube (Da Zao), Licorice (Gan Cao), Ginseng (Ren Shen)

syndromes.name: 小建中湯證 / Xiao Jian Zhong Tang pattern
syndromes.description: 治中焦虛寒、脘腹綿痛、喜溫喜按之裏虛證。 / Treats middle jiao cold deficiency with intermittent abdominal pain relieved by warmth and pressure.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 桂枝三兩、炙甘草二兩、大棗十二枚、芍藥六兩、生薑三兩、膠飴一升 / Cinnamon Twig (Gui Zhi) 3 liang, Honey-fried Licorice (Zhi Gan Cao) 2 liang, Jujubes (Da Zao) 12 pieces, Peony (Shao Yao) 6 liang, Fresh Ginger (Sheng Jiang) 3 liang, Maltose syrup (Jiao Yi)

syndromes.name: 大小承氣湯證 / Da/Xiao Chengqi Tang patterns
syndromes.description: 陽明腑實或大小承氣證，主大便閉結、譫語、煩渴及腹實之證。 / Patterns of purging heat accumulation in the Yangming (Da or Xiao Chengqi), presenting with constipation with delirium, great thirst, and abdominal fullness.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 大黃、芒硝、枳實等攻下泻下藥 / Rhubarb (Da Huang), Mirabilite (Mang Xiao), Immature Bitter Orange (Zhi Shi) and other purgatives

syndromes.name: 柴胡白虎湯證 / Chai Hu Bai Hu Tang pattern
syndromes.name_en: Chai Hu Bai Hu Tang pattern
syndromes.description: 少陽與陽明夾雜之證，兼見煩渴與往來寒熱者，可用小柴胡加白虎類合方。 / Combined Shaoyang-Yangming pattern with vexation and thirst; a modification combining Chai Hu and Bai Hu formulas.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 柴胡、石膏、知母、甘草等（小柴胡與白虎加減） / Bupleurum (Chai Hu), Gypsum (Shi Gao), Anemarrhena (Zhi Mu), Licorice (Gan Cao) (combination of Xiao Chai Hu and Bai Hu herbs)

syndromes.name: 大柴胡湯證 / Da Chai Hu Tang pattern
syndromes.description: 兼治少陽與陽明之間的夾雜證，見嘔吐、腹滿、實滿便秘、胸脅苦滿等。 / Pattern that treats combined Shaoyang and Yangming disorders, presenting with persistent vomiting, abdominal distention, constipation with focal hardness, and hypochondriac/fullness.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 柴胡、黃芩、芍藥、半夏、生薑、枳實、大棗、大黃 / Bupleurum (Chai Hu), Scutellaria (Huang Qin), Peony (Shao Yao), Pinellia (Ban Xia), Fresh Ginger (Sheng Jiang), Immature Bitter Orange (Zhi Shi), Jujube (Da Zao), Rhubarb (Da Huang)

syndromes.name: 炙甘草湯證 / Zhi Gan Cao Tang pattern
syndromes.description: 用於脈結代、虛勞心悸及虛寒脈弱之證，補脾益氣並調和心脈。 / Pattern for knotted-intermittent pulse, palpitations from deficiency, and weak cold pulse; nourishes spleen qi and harmonizes the pulse.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 炙甘草、人參、乾薑等 / Honey-fried Licorice (Zhi Gan Cao), Ginseng (Ren Shen), Dried Ginger (Gan Jiang), etc.

syndromes.name: 柴胡證 / Chai Hu pattern (Shao Yang/Chaihu pattern)
syndromes.description: 少陽證表現有胸脇滿、嘔吐、往來寒熱，可能兼見日晡潮熱，先解表再攻裏。 / Shao Yang/Chai Hu pattern marked by chest and hypochondriac fullness, vomiting, and alternating chills and fever; may show late‑afternoon tidal fever; treat by releasing the exterior first then regulating the interior.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 小柴胡湯，後加芒硝（柴胡加芒硝湯） / Xiao Chai Hu Tang initially, followed by Xiao Chai Hu plus Mang Xiao (Chai Hu Jia Mang Xiao Tang)

syndromes.name: 瘀血證 / Blood stasis pattern
syndromes.description: 局部或全身血液流通不暢，見胸腹拘痛、舌紫或舌中紫斑、膈俞痛、舌齒痕等。 / Pattern of blood stasis with impaired circulation, presenting with fixed stabbing pains, abdominal or chest masses, tongue with purple spots, Geshu point tenderness, and teeth‑marked tongue.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 桃核承氣湯、下瘀血湯、桂枝茯苓丸等 / Tao He Cheng Qi Tang, Xia Yu Xue Tang, Gui Zhi Fu Ling Wan, formulas used to move blood and resolve stasis

syndromes.name: 膀胱熱結（瘀血及熱結於膀胱） / Bladder heat accumulation / bladder blood‑heat pattern
syndromes.name_zh: 膀胱熱結（瘀血及熱結於膀胱）
syndromes.name_en: Bladder heat accumulation / bladder blood‑heat pattern
syndromes.description: 膀胱或小便道內熱結或瘀血導致小便短赤、帶血、少腹拘急，伴譫語或狂躁。 / Heat or blood‑heat accumulated in the bladder causing scanty, bloody or reddish urine, lower abdominal tension, and possible delirium or agitation.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 桃核承氣湯 / Tao He Cheng Qi Tang (Tao He Chengqi Tang)

syndromes.name: 半表半裏、三焦水道堵塞（誤下後的半表半裏證） / Half‑exterior half‑interior with Jiao water‑path obstruction (post‑misapplied purging)
syndromes.name_zh: 半表半裏、三焦水道堵塞（誤下後的半表半裏證）
syndromes.name_en: Half‑exterior half‑interior with Jiao water‑path obstruction (post‑misapplied purging)
syndromes.description: 表證未解且被誤下攻後，病邪陷於表裏之間，表裏互結，表現胸滿、驚煩、小便不利、譫語、一身重等。 / Condition where exterior signs persist yet the patient was inappropriately purged, causing pathogen to lodge between exterior and interior (half‑exterior/half‑interior), with chest fullness, agitation, urinary difficulty, delirium, and heavy body.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 柴胡加龍骨牡蠣湯（加大黃半夏等） / Chai Hu Jia Long Gu Mu Li Tang (Chai Hu plus Longgu and Muli), often including Da Huang, Ban Xia, Ren Shen, Sheng Jiang, Da Zao

syndromes.name: 浮陽上擾兼失津（燙傷/火災急症） / Floating yang uprising with fluid loss (thermal burn/fire trauma emergency)
syndromes.name_zh: 浮陽上擾兼失津（燙傷/火災急症）
syndromes.name_en: Floating yang uprising with fluid loss (thermal burn/fire trauma emergency)
syndromes.description: 火傷或被火炙烤後津液外被驅散、陽浮上擾，出現頭汗、驚狂、起臥不安、皮膚水疱與多痰等。 / After thermal injury or fire exposure, body fluids are driven outward and yang floats, causing head‑only sweating, agitation/delirium, inability to settle, blisters, and copious phlegm; urgent calming and fluid/yang resuscitation indicated.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 桂枝去芍藥加蜀漆龍骨牡蠣救逆湯，外用牡蠣粉、麻油等。 / Gui Zhi (without Shao Yao) plus Shu Chi, Long Gu and Mu Li rescue‑reversal decoction; topical Mu Li, sesame oil, sulfur/Da Huang preparations for burns.

syndromes.name: 桂枝加桂湯證 / Gui Zhi Jia Gui Tang pattern
syndromes.name_en: Gui Zhi Jia Gui Tang pattern
syndromes.description: 治奔豚等因腸胃濁氣上逆、心臟噴射迫回濁氣之證。常以桂枝湯加肉桂以振發心陽。 / Pattern treated by Gui Zhi Jia Gui Tang for running‑piglet sensation due to turbid intestinal qi rising and being forced back by cardiac discharge; uses Gui Zhi Tang with added cinnamon (Rougui) to strengthen cardiac yang.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 以桂枝湯加肉桂（桂枝、白芍、炙甘草、生薑、大棗，加少量肉桂）為主。 / Gui Zhi Tang plus added Rougui (Cinnamon): Gui Zhi, Shao Yao, Zhi Gan Cao, Sheng Jiang, Da Zao, with small amount of Rougui.

syndromes.name: 桂苓甘草龍骨牡蠣湯證 / Gui Ling Gan Cao Long Gu Mu Li Tang pattern
syndromes.name_zh: 桂苓甘草龍骨牡蠣湯證
syndromes.name_en: Gui Ling Gan Cao Long Gu Mu Li Tang pattern
syndromes.description: 因發汗過多或火逆造成浮陽上擾、煩躁心悸，兼有失津、盜汗或頭部出汗之證。 / Pattern for irritability and palpitations from excessive sweating or fire reversal with floating yang disturbance, fluid loss, night sweating or head‑only sweating.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 常用藥：桂枝、甘草、龍骨、牡蠣、茯苓等。 / Typical herbs: Gui Zhi, Gan Cao, Long Gu, Mu Li, Fu Ling.

syndromes.name: 火逆 / fire reversal pattern
syndromes.description: 火邪上逆致陽亢、下焦水停，表現為煩躁、腰以下沉重痺麻及口咽乾燥或吐血下血等。 / Pathogenic fire rising counterflow causing yang hyperactivity and inferior fluid stagnation, presenting with agitation, lower‑body heaviness/numbness, throat dryness, and possible hematemesis or hematochezia.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 治法以汗解或清熱瀉火並調和營衛；方例如桂枝加桂湯、桂苓甘草龍骨牡蠣湯等。 / Treat by inducing sweating or clearing heat and harmonizing ying‑wei; example formulas include Gui Zhi Jia Gui Tang and Gui Ling Gan Cao Long Gu Mu Li Tang.

syndromes.name: 大半夏湯證 / Da Ban Xia Tang pattern
syndromes.description: 因過度採用吐法或嘔吐過多，傷及胃中津液，胃氣虛弱而發生的證候。主要見腹中饑而口不能食、嘔吐或噁心，脈屬關上細數（關脈細而數，表示胃虛而有虛熱），有時因津液大傷而生內煩、渴或朝食暮吐等變化。若吐一二日者主要為胃津不足（可用大半夏湯止嘔補胃津）；吐三四日則可能兼及脾，胃冷、胃陽不足，喜冷食或朝食暮吐宜另用溫中回陽方。治則以止嘔、和胃、補胃津為要，方用半夏止嘔開胃、人人參補胃生津、白蜜和中潤藥、增強停藥於胃中之效。需與吳茱萸湯、桂枝白虎湯、人參白虎湯等證候相辨以決加減。 / A pattern caused by excessive induced vomiting or prolonged vomiting that injures the stomach fluids (jin), producing stomach qi deficiency. Clinically: abdominal hunger with inability to eat, vomiting or nausea; the guan pulse is thin and rapid (indicating stomach deficiency with relative heat). There may be inner vexation, thirst, or, if prolonged, signs of spleen involvement with cold in the stomach and morning-to-evening vomiting. Treatment principle: stop vomiting, harmonize and replenish stomach fluids and restore stomach qi. Da Ban Xia Tang (Major Pinellia Decoction) is used: Banxia to stop vomiting and open the stomach, Renshen to replenish stomach fluids and qi, and honey to moderate and nourish and to help the medicine remain in the stomach. Differentiate and modify: if marked thirst and vexation from severe fluid loss consider Ren Shen Bai Hu-type approach; if exterior heat without fluid loss consider Gui Zhi Bai Hu modification; if morning-evening vomiting or stomach prolapse with cold signs consider Wu Zhu Yu Tang.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 方藥（大半夏湯）: 半夏、人參、白蜜。半夏止嘔、和胃、開胃；人參補脾益胃、生津填髓、補胃津；白蜜生用和中潤燥、緩急並增藥力使藥停胃中。臨證可依證加減（如吐後渴煩用人參白虎類方，朝食暮吐偏寒用吳茱萸湯等）。 / Formula (Da Ban Xia Tang): Banxia (Pinellia), Renshen (Ginseng), Baimi (honey). Banxia: stops vomiting, transforms damp-phlegm, opens the stomach and relieves nausea. Renshen: tonifies spleen and stomach, generates fluids (shengjin) and restores depleted stomach fluids/qi. Baimi (raw honey): moderates and harmonizes the formula, moistens and replenishes, and helps retain the medicine in the stomach. Modify according to presentation (e.g., severe thirst and vexation → Ren Shen Bai Hu type approach; morning-to-evening vomiting with cold signs → Wu Zhu Yu Tang).

syndromes.name: 吳茱萸湯證 / Wu Zhu Yu Tang pattern
syndromes.description: 胃寒下垂或胃虛寒甚，表現為朝食暮吐、喜冷食者，用吳茱萸湯溫中回陽。 / Pattern of marked stomach deficiency-cold or gastric ptosis presenting as morning food vomited by evening and relief with cold foods; treated with Wu Zhu Yu Tang to warm the center and restore stomach yang.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 常用人參、生薑（或乾薑）、紅棗、吳茱萸等溫中健脾藥。 / Common herbs include Ginseng, fresh or dried ginger (Sheng/Dried Jiang), Jujube (Hong Zao), and Evodia (Wu Zhu Yu) to warm and strengthen the spleen-stomach.

syndromes.name: 桂枝白虎湯證 / Gui Zhi Bai Hu Tang pattern
syndromes.name_en: Gui Zhi Bai Hu Tang pattern
syndromes.description: 外有表熱兼內陽明熱但胃津未傷，見發熱而不甚口渴者，可用桂枝白虎湯。 / Pattern of concurrent exterior disorder and Yangming internal heat without depleted stomach fluids, presenting with fever but little thirst; treated by substituting Gui Zhi into a Bai Hu-type approach.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 處方以桂枝、石膏等，去人人參而解表兼清裡熱。 / Formula emphasizes Gui Zhi and gypsum (Shi Gao), removing ginseng to address the exterior and clear interior heat.

syndromes.name: 抵當湯證 / Di Dang Tang pattern
syndromes.description: 瘀熱入下焦，少腹硬滿、小便自利、或見發狂者，為下焦瘀血之證。辨證要點：小便自利者多屬瘀血在大腸、子宮等下焦諸處，宜用抵當湯攻破下血；反之小便不利者多屬膀胱瘀結，宜桃核承氣湯。抵當湯藥力峻猛，主破瘀下行，服藥後常見瘀血由大便、小便或陰部排出，虛弱者慎用，需視情改用地黃等補法或改丸劑，見下血即止藥。 / Blood-stasis heat lodged in the lower burner producing firm lower-abdominal distension, often with free urination or even mania — a pattern of lower‑jiao blood stasis. Diagnostic key: unobstructed/smooth urination (xiaobian zili) suggests stasis located in the lower‑jiao (large intestine, uterus, etc.) amenable to Di Dang Tang; difficult or scanty urination points to bladder stasis (Taohe Chengqi Tang). Di Dang Tang is a very strong, blood‑breaking formula that forces stasis downward and commonly produces bloody discharge by stool, urine, or genital bleeding; use cautiously in weak patients, modify (eg. replace Da Huang with rehmannia) or use the pill form and stop when bleeding is achieved.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 方藥（湯）：水蛭三十個（熬）、虻蟲三十個（去翅）、桃仁二十個（去皮尖）、大黃三兩（酒洗）；以水五升煮取三升，去滓，溫服一升，未下再服。丸方則水蛭二十、虻蟲二十五、桃仁二十、大黃三兩，杵為四丸，水一升煮一丸取七合服之。炮製要點：水蛭、虻蟲烤焦黃（不可黑炭）、去翅去足，桃仁去皮尖；若病人虛弱可將大黃改為地黃以兼顧補虛（通經丸），服藥後見下血即停，慎防出血風險並留意體弱者禁忌。 / Formula (decoction): Shui Zhi (leeches) 30 pieces (simmered), Mang Chong (tabanus/horsefly) 30 pieces (remove wings), Tao Ren (peach kernel) 20 pieces (remove skin tip), Da Huang (rhubarb) 3 liang (wash in alcohol); decoct 5 sheng of water down to 3 sheng, strain and take 1 sheng warm; repeat if no downward discharge. Pill form: Shui Zhi 20, Mang Chong 25, Tao Ren 20, Da Huang 3 liang, made into four pills, boil 1 pill in 1 sheng water and take ~7 he (traditional measure) at a time; raw honey may be used to form pills. Preparation notes: roast animal ingredients to brown (not char), remove wings/legs of flies; for very weak patients replace Da Huang with cooked Rehmannia (di huang) to avoid excessive debilitation. This is a harsh, quick‑acting blood‑breaking prescription — monitor for bleeding and stop when stasis is discharged.

syndromes.name: 抵當丸證 / Di Dang Wan pattern
syndromes.description: 為抵當湯之丸劑化，主治瘀血在下焦之較緩證或慢證，服丸以蜜為丸蓋。 / Pill form of Di Dang formula for lower‑burner blood stasis in less acute or chronic cases; pills are formed with honey and taken to induce discharge of stasis.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 主要藥物：水蛭、虻蟲、桃仁、大黃（研末蜜丸）。 / Main herbs are leech, horsefly, peach kernel, and rhubarb, ground and formed into honey pills.

syndromes.name: 桃核承氣湯證 / Tao He Cheng Qi Tang pattern
syndromes.name_en: Tao He Cheng Qi Tang pattern
syndromes.description: 以活血逐瘀為主，常用於膀胱或下焦瘀熱小便不利之候，藥力相對較緩和。 / A blood-activating, purgative pattern used for lower‑burner blood-heat and small‑amount urination, with milder dispersing action than Di Dang Tang.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 常用桃仁、大黃等破瘀通下之藥。 / Commonly contains peach kernel (Tao Ren), rhubarb (Da Huang), and other blood‑moving purgatives.

syndromes.name: 茵陳蒿湯證 / Yin Chen Hao Tang pattern
syndromes.description: 下焦濕熱或膀胱熱郁而見身黃、目黃者，主以茵陳蒿清利濕熱。 / Pattern of damp-heat in the lower burner or bladder presenting with body/skin jaundice; treated with Yin Chen Hao Tang to clear damp-heat.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 以茵陳蒿為君，佐以利濕退黃藥。 / Chief herb is Artemisia capillaris (Yin Chen Hao), supported by herbs that drain dampness and reduce jaundice.

syndromes.name: 豬苓湯證 / Zhu Ling Tang pattern
syndromes.description: 膀胱結石或腎石導致小便不利、尿少或尿痛者，可用豬苓湯利水通淋。 / Pattern of bladder or kidney stone causing difficult, reduced or painful urination; treated with Zhu Ling Tang to promote urination and resolve strangury.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 以豬苓、茯苓、澤瀉等利水藥為主。 / Main herbs include Polyporus (Zhu Ling), Poria (Fu Ling), Alisma (Ze Xie) to promote diuresis and relieve strangury.

syndromes.name: 臟結 / Zang Jie (visceral binding)
syndromes.description: 陰寒內結、臟腑陽氣衰竭之證，表現安靜、舌苔滑、寒濕內結之象，不可輕易攻下，宜溫補扶陽。 / Pattern of internal cold-damp congealment in the viscera with depleted yang, manifested by quietness, slippery tongue coating, and cold-damp binding; avoid harsh purgatives and instead warm and support yang.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 治法以溫補為主，常用理中湯、四逆湯等溫中扶陽方劑。 / Treatment centers on warming and tonifying yang; formulas such as Li Zhong Tang or Si Ni Tang are used to warm the center and rescue yang.

syndromes.name: 小結胸證 / 小陷胸證 / Xiao Xian Xiong pattern (Small Collapsed Chest)
syndromes.name_zh: 小結胸證 / 小陷胸證
syndromes.name_en: Xiao Xian Xiong pattern (Small Collapsed Chest)
syndromes.description: 痰熱或痰濕局限於心下，按之則痛，脈浮滑，常伴噁心嘔吐，證輕於大陷胸證。 / Phlegm‑heat or phlegm‑damp localized under the epigastrium causing pain on pressure, a floating‑slippery pulse and often nausea/vomiting; milder than Da Xian Xiong pattern.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 主治方為小陷胸湯（黃連、半夏、栝蔞實）。 / Primary treatment: Xiao Xian Xiong Tang (Coptis, Pinellia, Trichosanthes fruit).

syndromes.name: 熱實結胸 / 熱結胸 / Heat‑excess Xian Xiong (Hot consolidation in chest)
syndromes.name_en: Heat‑excess Xian Xiong (Hot consolidation in chest)
syndromes.description: 胸中主要為熱痰實結，脈沈而緊，心下痛、舌乾渴，常有高熱或壯熱，宜瀉熱逐痰。 / Chest consolidation dominated by heat and phlegm with a deep‑tight pulse, epigastric pain, dry tongue and thirst; often with high or robust fever and indication for purging heat and resolving phlegm.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 主用大陷胸湯或加力之劑。 / Treated with Da Xian Xiong Tang or stronger purgative regimens.

syndromes.name: 麻杏甘石湯證 / Ma Xing Gan Shi Tang pattern
syndromes.name_en: Ma Xing Gan Shi Tang pattern
syndromes.description: 脈細數且喉痛、咳吐黃稠痰等肺實熱或肺胃夾熱證，宣肺降胃熱、止咳平喘。 / Pattern treated by Ma Xing Gan Shi Tang for fine-rapid pulse with throat pain, cough and thick yellow sputum—indicative of lung heat or combined lung-stomach heat; it opens the lung and clears gastric heat to stop cough.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 麻黃、杏仁、石膏、甘草 / Ma Huang (Ephedra), Xing Ren (Armeniaca/Apricot seed), Shi Gao (Gypsum), Gan Cao (Licorice)

syndromes.name: 文蛤散證 / Wen Ge (Meretrix) powder pattern
syndromes.description: 治表有水飲、汗不得出、小便不利、肉上粟起、欲飲反不渴等水飲停留於表與胸中的證候，以鹹散利水導濕。 / Pattern for water-retention at the surface and chest with poor sweating, scanty or difficult urination, piloerection and desire to drink without thirst; uses salty Meretrix powder to mobilize and eliminate water.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 文蛤（打粉散服） / Meretrix (clam) powder

syndromes.name: 三物小白散 / Sanwu Xiaobai San (Three-ingredient small white powder)
syndromes.name_en: Sanwu Xiaobai San (Three-ingredient small white powder)
syndromes.description: 主治寒實結胸、胸膈痞滿、舌苔白滑者，劑量甚小以攻散堅實痞塊。 / Used for cold-solid chest binding with chest and epigastric fullness and a white slippery tongue; administered in very small doses to disperse stubborn masses.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 巴豆、桔梗、貝母（少量） / Croton seed (Ba Dou), Jie Geng (Platycodon), Bei Mu (Fritillaria) in small quantities

syndromes.name: 熱入血室 / heat entering the blood chamber (blood-chamber heat)
syndromes.name_en: heat entering the blood chamber (blood-chamber heat)
syndromes.description: 婦人感冒或發熱於經來或停經前後，熱入血中或血室，表現為胸脅下滿、譫語或瘧狀發作，宜刺期門或小柴胡湯調治。 / Condition in women where febrile pathogen enters the blood chamber (uterus/liver) around menstruation, presenting with hypochondriac fullness, delirium or intermittent fever resembling malaria; treat by needling Qimen or with Xiao Chai Hu Tang.
syndromes.herbal_treatments: 小柴胡湯（或依證刺期門） / Xiao Chai Hu Tang (or acupuncture at Qimen depending on presentation)

syndromes.name: 陽微結 / mild-yang binding (Yang-withered binding)
syndromes.description: 表證猶存而裏微結，表裏夾雜，頭汗出而手足冷、心下滿、脈沉細者，屬陽微結，可與小柴胡湯調理。 / A mild yang-binding pattern with concurrent exterior signs and slight interior binding: head sweating with cold extremities, epigastric fullness and a faint-deep pulse; typically treated with Xiao Chai Hu Tang.

syndromes.name: 半夏瀉心湯證 / Banxia Xiexin Tang pattern
syndromes.description: 半夏瀉心湯證為少陽證或表證入少陽後引發的腸胃不和證候。臨床主症為心下痞滿（按之軟或稍濡）、嘔吐（嘔酸、噯氣）、腹中雷鳴、下利（水樣瀉）、寒熱夾雜、口不渴或時渴，舌苔多見黃或薄白。病因常為先有表證而被誤攻下或先發表未解，表邪入裏，腸胃津液失調，水飲停聚於胃周或腸中，食滯腐敗而生熱，寒熱膠結成痞。按診可辨「痞硬」（結胸或實結）與按之自濡之氣痞（多為氣水夾結或胃虛客氣）。舌苔提示：苔黃多屬有熱，用黃芩、黃連；若黃而乾燥甚，當取清熱更劑如石膏；薄白苔可見於表寒未解或胃寒偏寒的情形。主要鑑別及加減：嘔為半夏瀉心主證；若下利、水瀉明顯重用生薑瀉心湯；胃虛客氣、噯氣而無宿食臭者以甘草瀉心湯為主；若上焦實熱或上部出血、重熱證則用大黃黃連瀉心湯或其變方；若表虛兼惡寒汗出可用附子瀉心湯；腸胃有水飲或小便不利合併口渴時需兼以五苓散化水。臨床用藥以半夏降逆祛水、黃芩黃連清裡火、乾薑或生薑回溫散水、補劑（人參、甘草、大棗）益胃津為主，視寒熱、虛實與水飲情形加減。 / Banxia Xiexin Tang pattern is a Shaoyang-related or post-Shaoyang-entry pattern producing disharmony of the stomach and intestines. Key manifestations: epigastric «pi» or fullness (on palpation soft or slightly moist), vomiting (often sour regurgitation, belching), borborygmus, watery diarrhea, mixed cold and heat signs, variable thirst; tongue coating often yellow or thin-white. Etiology commonly: a prior exterior disorder was wrongly purged or inadequately released so that pathogens entered the interior, disrupting digestive fluids (jinye), causing water accumulation around the stomach or in the intestines, food retention and focal heat; cold–heat complex leads to «pi». Palpation distinguishes «hard pi» (true binding/obstruction, e.g. xiekong or da xianxiong patterns) from moist/soft «qi-pi» due to qi or water stagnation or stomach deficiency. Tongue coating: yellow indicates interior heat—use huangqin/huanglian; if yellow and very dry consider stronger heat‑clearing (e.g. gypsum). Thin-white may indicate lingering exterior cold or stomach cold. Therapeutic principles: harmonize Shaoyang and middle burner, descend rebellious qi, transform phlegm-water and clear focal inflammation.
